loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: don Manuel vive en casa propia;el posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad esta ubicada en el lugar de su residencia solicita un crédito que le permita comprar mas granos basicos, Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios.
texts.en: Manuel lives in his own home.  He has a store, located in his house, from which he sells everyday items.  He is seeking a loan so that he can buy more basic grains.  He is seeking the loan since he has no other sources of income apart from his business.

loans.use: to invest more in his shop.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy was born in 1974. She has two children. Her daughters in the 3rd grade and the 9th grade. Her husband is a driver. His income is about 4,000,000 VND per month. Thuy has been working as a barber for three years. Her income is about 4,000,000 VND per month. Her family’s total earnings are about 8,000,000 VND per month. 

Thuy has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2005. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,810,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 11,118,000 VND to buy barber tools for her barber shop.

loans.use: to buy barber tools for her barber shop.

loans.name: Sareth's Group

texts.en: Sareth is 61 years old and a father of six children. He resides in Kandal province where rice and vegetable growing are the most popular businesses. Sareth is a peasant, and he has grown rice and vegetables for 36 years. Sareth has never taken a loan through with VisionFund before. He is applying for his first microfinance loan with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) as a member of a two-person borrower group. He wants to build a decent latrine for his family, which encouraged him to request this loan. He hopes that this construction will improve the hygiene of the family.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine

loans.name: Muzamiru

texts.en:
Muzamiru is 40 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, with three of them currently in school. For the past six years, Muzamiru has been working hard to manage his salon, which cuts men's hair. 

To help expand his business, Muzamiru has requested a loan of 3000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more machines for the hair, and will help Muzamiru to generate greater profits, boost the business and increase their income. Muzamiru hopes that in the future he will be able to improve on the family well-being. 

Muzamiru is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Muzamiru who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more machines for the hair.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Despite her situation as a single parent, separated from her husband for three and one-half years, Arlene is able to sustain her children's needs. For over three years she has owned a restaurant located at a public market in Cordon that also serves as her retail store. Arlene's goal is to have a profitable business so she can educate her four children.

Arlene is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy meat, vegetables, ingredients and cases of soft drinks for her eatery. She hopes for approval of her loan so she can keep her restaurant progressive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, ingredients and cases of soft drinks for her eatery.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a divorced mother with four children all of whom attend school. Mwaka considers herself a hard-worker who is responsible and really wants to better herself. 

Thanks to her entrepreneurial spirit, she set up a business making food, which she has been running from home for four years. Everyday Mwaka gets up at 5 a.m. to prepare food for selling. She enjoys her job a lot.

The aim of this loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business by buying staple goods for food production, including purchasing maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and tea leaves.

Mwaka is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders offer to people with scarce resources, so that they can have a way of working with dignity.

loans.use: purchase staple goods for food production, including maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and tea leaves.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia de 29 años es una mujer de mucha actividad laboral , esta casada con Alberto  y juntos tienen una niña de 8 años.
Posee junto a su pareja una vivienda construida  a base de material noble producto de muchos años de trabajo.
Posee una parcela en la cual produce cacao orgánico, al ser una persona muy activa logro con el tiempo expandirla y dedicarse con el paso de los años a la administración directa de la producción.
Lleva 3 años a cargo de sus parcelas y siempre tuvo en mente buscar dedicarse solo a la administración de las mismas brindándo asi una  oportunidad laboral a muchos jóvenes en su localidad.
Para el normal desempeño de sus actividades requiere contar con capital para la compra de abonos el cual es necesario para que sus plantaciones obtengan una producción de calidad al finalizar la temporada previa  a la cosecha.Sus objetivos económicos a largo plazo esperan lograr la compra de mas parcelas para dedicarlos a la producción de café orgánico y achiote el cual espera cumplirlo muy pronto y seguir mejorando la calidad de vida para su familia.En esta ocasión requiere contar con 1,500 soles para la compra de sacos de abono orgánico y así mejorar su producción.
texts.en:
Delia is 29 year old busy working woman.  She is married to Alberto and they have an 8 year old daughter.  They have a house, built of fine material, a product of many years of hard work.  They have a plot of land on which they produce organic cacao.  Being a very busy person, she expanded it and over time, she became engaged in the direct administration of production.  She has taken care of her plots for three years and always had it in mind to dedicate herself solely to administration and in this way, offer job opportunities to the young people in the area.

In order to carry out normal business activities, she needs capital to purchase fertilizers, which are necessary so that her plantings obtain a quality production at the end of the pre-season harvest.  Her long-term financial goal is to purchase more plots for the production of organic coffee and achiote (a spice made from the red seed of the annatto tree).  She hopes to achieve this goal and continue improving the quality of life for her family.  At this time, she is requesting 1,500 soles to purchase sacks of organic fertilizer and in this way, improve her production.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es: don oscar de 60 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus hijos, vive en casa propia, tiene 15 años de trabajar como agricultor y tiene cultivos de maiz y maicillo, esta solicitando un credito para mejorar su vivienda, ya que tiene construida solo una parte de ella y quiere terminarla de construir para que el y su familia puedan vivir mas comodos y tranquilos.
texts.en: Don Oscar, 60 years old, lives with his wife and children.  He lives in his own home.  He has worked for 15 years as a farmer and has crops of corn and sorghum.  He is requesting a loan to improve his home since he has only a part of it constructed and wants to finish the construction so that he and his family can live more comfortably and peacefully.

loans.use: to improve his home.

loans.name: Badamsuren

texts.en: Mrs. Badamsuren is 44 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a house in the Amgalan area of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband Purevsuren, age 42, works at the state-owned company as driver. Her son Purevdagva, age 20, is a university student and her daughter Purevmaa, age 15, goes to a local school. The borrower has been running her organic dairy products sales business in the local market since September 2012. She has worked as a saleswoman before and has experience in the business. She is now requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase a large quantity of organic dairy products to sell to local customers. She is a hardworking, self-asserting and honest woman.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of organic dairy products to sell to local customers

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is a 45-year-old married woman who lives in Solana with her spouse and children. She is raising hogs to sell for profits. She has been in this business for more than five years and earns about P5,000 for each hog disposed. She uses the profits to pay for meals and allowance for her children, who are in college earning a degree. 

Florencia is now asking for a loan of P5,000 to buy feed for maintaining hogs. It will help nourish the hogs so she can sell them for a higher price. 

With good income she will save for her family's future expenses, leading to income stability someday.

loans.use: to buy feed for maintaining hogs

loans.name: Nobert

texts.en: Nobert is a 29-year-old ambitious man living in Kasese, Uganda. For five years now he has been a banker, and with the proceeds, he has been able to buy a motorcycle for a transport business. He is a very determined man and wants to become a central bank governor in the future, and that is why he wants to upgrade his studies. Nobert intends to use the loan to pay school fees for himself.

loans.use: to pay school fees for himself.

loans.name: Thereza

texts.en:
Thereza used the previous loan to pay school fees for her children. She is a 48-year-old married woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. After assessing the lucrative nature of the transport sector, she decided to invest in motorcycle transport, and with the income earned, she has been able to buy land and pay school fees for her children. 

Thereza's courage is such as you can rarely find, given the cultural set-up that women are not supposed to ride motorcycles, but she does. She has been in business for three years. Her major challenges are high fuel costs and the poor road network, while her business dream is to hire out the motorcycle and venture into farming if she gets enough capital. Thereza is requesting a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal el El Progreso está conformado por 9 integrantes, 7 mujeres y dos hombres, madres y padres de familia, con 20 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. El sauce se carateriza por  la producción de productos lácteos, crema, leche, cuajada, queso. Los integrantes del esta banco son personas responsables, trabajadoras, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente ninguna pudo estudiar por falta de recursos económicos; por que luchan día a día para brindarle un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
La coordinadora del banco comunal el progreso es María Emperatriz, y tiene por actividad económica la venta de cosa de horno, comida típica de la región, actividad que la desempeña de forma ambulante, con una pana sobre su cabeza de unos 20 kg ofreciendo su  productos a clientes fijos y eventuales. El objetivo del crédito es para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de materia prima para elaborar las cosas de horno como maíz, leña, leche, cuajada, azúcar, bolsas plásticas. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal El progreso agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The El Progreso communal bank has 9 members, 7 women and two men, mothers and fathers with families and a total of 20 children in their care.  They are from El Sauce, a place that is located in the northern area of the country. El Sauce is known for the production of dairy products, cream, milk, curds and cheese. The members of this bank are responsible, hard-working people with the desire to get ahead. Unfortunately none of them were able to study; so they strive day after day to give their children a better future.

The coordinator of the El Progreso communal bank is María Emperatriz, and her business is the sale of baked goods, a typical food of the region. She runs her business in an itinerant fashion, with a 20 kg basket on her head, offering her products to established and potential clients. The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital, in the purchase of raw material for making baked goods like corn, firewood, milk, curds, sugar and plastic bags, so that she will have better earnings in the not-so-distant future. The El Progreso communal bank thanks the Kiva investors for their help providing people with scarce resources and poor countries like Nicaragua to have a dignified means of work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to buy raw material for making baked goods like corn, firewood, milk, curds, sugar and plastic bags.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es: Doña Maria de 52 años de edad vive con un familiar en casa propia, trabaja como vendedora de papas fritas cerca de su lugar de residencia, el negocio le ha generado una excelente rentabilidad, desea solicitar un credito con el fin de aumentar mas el inventario del negocio y mejorar los sartenes donde prepara las papas, y asi poder seguir llevando el sustento diario a su casa.
texts.en: Doña Maria, 52 years old, lives with a relative in her own home.  She works as a French fry seller near her place of residence.  The business has generated an excellent profitability for her.  She wants to apply for a loan with the goal of further increasing the inventory of her business and improving the frying pans where she prepares the potatoes and thus be able to continue bringing daily sustenance to her home.

loans.use: to improve her cooking utensils for her sales of French fries.

loans.name: Sonia Elsy

texts.es:
Sonia, se dedica a la venta de comida, tiene 45 años de edad, tiene dos hijos, su esposo esta fuera del país pero le ayuda económicamente, tiene 10 años de estar dedicada a este negocio, trabaja de lunes a viernes.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de una cocina y artículos que sean necesarios para elaborar los distintos menús, esta inversión le ayudara a Sonia, para poder mejorar en el negocio y realizar sus ventas diarias.
La aspiración de Sonia es que su negocio sea rentable, fortalecerlo, ayudar a su familia brindándole una buena condición de vida.
texts.en:
Sonia makes a living from selling food, is 45 years old and has two children. Her husband is out of the country but he helps her financially. She has had her business for 10 years and works from Monday to Friday. 

She is asking for a loan to buy a stove and other items necessary to make different menus. This investment will help Sonia to improve her business and achieve her daily sales.

Sonia's aspiration is that her business be profitable, to strengthen it and to help her family, providing them with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a stove and other items

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: Don Jose Antonio de 53 años de edad vive con su esposa y una nieta trabaja como agricultor desde hace mas de 31 años y con ese trabajo a podido llevar todos estos años el sustento a su familia, solicita un credito para compra de insumos que utilizara para la cosecha de sus semillas y poder seguirlos vendiendo y seguir llevando lo necesario a su hogar.
texts.en: Jose Antonio, 53 years old, lives with his wife and a granddaughter.  He has worked as a farmer for more than 31 years and with that work he has been able to bring sustenance to his family all these years.  He is requesting a loan to purchase supplies that he will use for the harvest of his seeds to be able to continue selling them and to continue bringing what is necessary to his home.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en: Deo used the previous loan to buy spraying chemicals for his garden. He is a 31-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He farms mainly vegetables and tomatoes. He faces the challenge of pests and diseases, which affects his output. His personal goals are educating his children up to the University and building a permanent house, while his business dream is to diversify and grow other crops like onions and beans. Deo intends to use the loan to pay for labor and buy chemicals to spray his tomatoes.

loans.use: to pay for labor and buy chemicals to spray his tomatoes.

loans.name: Rolinda

texts.en: Rolinda lives in Solana. She is 38 years old, married and has three children. Her spouse is a farmer. She sells vegetables as the source of her income. She usually acquires P5,000 each month and wants to increase her earnings for the education of her children. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of P5,000 to buy tomatoes, beans, eggplant and cabbages to sell. She hopes to keep extending good products and services to all her costumers and keep saving funds to sustain her children's needs. Her photo was taken on her way to purchase vegetables at the market.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, beans, eggplant and cabbages to sell

loans.name: Erika Mercedez

texts.es:
Erika es una mujer de 34 años de edad casada, luchadora, emprendedora que con su esposo tienen 2 hijos los cuales son menores de edad el mayor de 8 años estudia en la escuela y ayuda a sus padres al salir de sus actividades escolares y un menor de edad ambos dependen de ellos en todos los aspectos. Ella tiene un conocimiento de educación primaria completo cursado hasta sexto grado pero ella no pudo seguir estudiando ya que sus padres son de bajos recursos y en ocasiones les era muy difícil seguirla apoyando por lo cual decidieron enseñarle desde muy pequeña el oficio de la agricultura actividad que es realizada hasta hoy en día por su familia. Ella cultiva hortalizas como ser Chile, pepino y tomate el cuales comercializado en pequeña escala en el sector donde ella habita y con algunos compradores que vienen de afuera de la zona. Sus cultivos están ubicados a una distancia de un kilómetro de distancia de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan a pie diariamente.
   
Hoy en día ella solicita ayuda para poder comprar fertilizantes y abono para sus cultivos de hortalizas ya que requieren de mucho cuidado por las diferentes plagas y animales que dañan las siembras y ella y su esposo en compañía de su hijo son los únicos en dar asistencia y mantenimiento al mismo.

Su sueño es que sus hortalizas sean las más productivas para poder así darles un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos y educarlos  para que ellos tengan la oportunidad de estudiar ya que el cultivo de hortalizas es la única fuente de trabajo y de ingresos de su familia.
texts.en:
Erika is a 34 year old hard-working, entrepreneur.  She is married and has two young children.  The older child is 8, attends school and also helps his parents after school.  Both children depend on them for everything.  She has a primary school education and completed up to sixth grade, but she couldn’t continue studying because her parents were poor. Sometimes, it was very difficult for them to continue supporting her so, at a very young age, they decided to teach her the farming trade, an activity that she is still engaged in today to support her family.  She grows vegetables such as chili peppers, cucumbers, and tomatoes which she markets on a small scale in the area where she lives and to some buyers that live outside of the area.  Her crops are located one kilometer from her house and she travels on foot daily.

Today, she is requesting help to purchase fertilizers and organic fertilizer for her vegetable crops, which require much care because of the pests and animas that damage the sowing.  She, her husband, and her son are the only ones who care for and maintain the crops.

Her dream is that her vegetables yield the highest production.  This will enable her to provide her children with a better standard of living and to educate them so that they have the opportunity to study because growing vegetables is the family’s only source of work and income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and organic fertilizer for her vegetable crops.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a 29-year-old married woman and a mother of four young children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She and her husband are engaged in a fishing business together for more than nine years now.

Gemma is asking for a loan to buy materials, like plywood, nails and paint, for the repair of the fishing boat. With this, they will be able to maintain the good working condition of the boat.

In the future, Gemma hopes to expand their fishing business and save money for the schooling of their children and to finance their daily needs.

loans.use: to buy materials for the repair of the fishing boat like plywood, nails and paint

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 55 years old and has seven children. Nida is married and has two children who are in school.

Nida is in the agricultural business, farming banana in the Philippines. Nida requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers for her banana farm.

Nida has been farming bananas for 10 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain the farm.

In the future, Nida would like to save enough money to buy farm lands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her banana farm.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
This is Corazon. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy all the needed spare parts and supplies needed in her repair shop. She is in this business for five years now and it keeps on growing. She also has a direct selling business for additional income. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and supplies needed in her appliance repair shop. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Corazon dreams of having a bigger stall for her business and hopes that her children will have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and that is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and supplies for her appliance repair shop.

loans.name: Macedonia

texts.es:
Macedonia de 46 años, viuda y con 2 hijos vive en  una vivienda construida a base de material noble como producto de muchos años de trabajo.Desde hace aproximadamente 20 años viene laborando como productora de cacao orgánico gracias a unas parcelas que obtuvo en calidad de herencia por parte de sus padres.
Para el normal desempeño de sus labores cuenta siempre con el apoyo de trabajadores del lugar quienes se encargan de las actividades mas colectivas como son el deshierbo y deschuponado de las plantaciones.
Siente sentirse muy a gusto con su actividad puesto que son parcelas en las que apoyaba desde muy niña logrando asi convertirlas  en un buen sustento para su economía familiar.
Al hallarse en medio de su campaña productiva desea contar con capital para proceder con el respectivo deshierbo esperando de esta manera optimizar como de costumbre la calidad final de sus mazorcas.
Sus planes a largo plazo apuntan a la construcción del segundo piso de su casa y posteriormente el habilitado de la misma, esto con motivo de buscar un ingreso fijo para su futuro.Requiere contar en esta ocasión con  S/.500 nuevos soles y contratar a trabajadores para llevar a cabo el segundo y necesario deshierbo de su parcela.
texts.en:
Macedonia, 46 years old, is a widow with two children. She lives in a good house that was built after years of hard work. She has made a living producing organic cocoa for over 20 years on some plots of land that she inherited from her parents. Macedonia normally hires workers to help with various tasks such as weeding throughout all of her fields. 

Macedonia really enjoys the work she does. She has earned a good living for herself and her family from these plots of land since she was young. Finding herself in the middle of the busiest season, Macedonia hopes to secure enough capital to carry out the necessary weeding. She is hoping this will help her to improve the quality of her cocoa pods. 

Her long-term plans include building the second floor of her house and later have it authorized to rent out, which would secure a fixed source of income for her in the future. 

Macedonia needs 500 Peruvian soles to pay workers to carry out the second weeding necessary for her land.

loans.use: to pay her workers.

loans.name: Avtandil

texts.en:
Avtandil is 57 years old. He lives in Terjola District with his 55-year-old wife, Maro. Avtandil requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Avtandil and his wife are farmers; they have 22 pigs, and they are selling piglets at the local markets. Also, they own a vineyard, and with the harvested grapes, he makes wine and vodka and sells it locally at the markets, which gives them a small monthly income. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Avtandil requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Avtandil will start a poultry business. In particular, he will purchase chicks and chicken food. He already has a coop where he plans to keep them. After the chicks are grown, Avtandil will sell eggs and chicken. This will increase the income of the family, and he will reinvest the profit in his agricultural business. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and chicken food.

loans.name: Kadii's Group

texts.en: Kadii is a 59-year-old mother of six children. She works as house help, but notes that the pay is very low. Kadii wants to join the KOMAZA microforestry program "so as to improve [her] life when trees are harvested and sold." She plans to use the profits from her tree farm to educate her children. Kadii's favorite part about being a KOMAZA farmer is interacting with fellow farmers and learning more information from the KOMAZA staff. She aspires to "be a role model in society" and to be in a better position to meet almost all her needs.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 36 años , esta casado con Delfina de 33 años, juntos tienen 3 pequeños hijos , con quienes comparte el fruto de su esfuerzo y dedicación.
Comparte sus vivencias familiares en una vivienda construida a base de madera.Se dedica netamente a las actividades productivas concernientes a al mantenimiento de cacao orgánico. Lleva 15 años en el rubro y logró iniciarse de manera fluida gracias a unas parcelas que heredo de sus padres en agradecimiento por su apoyo desde muy niño.Con el paso de los años ha logrado sacarle el máximo provecho a esta actividad  y ha logrado adquirir otras parcelas adicionales mejorando así sus ingresos económicos.
Le agrada mucho su trabajo puesto que al poseer una terreno propio  prioriza su trabajo y brinda buenos frutos a sus clientes. No obstante la temporada de lluvias perjudica e impide el normal desempeño de sus tareas agrícolas..Sus objetivos económicos a largo plazo apuntan a la compra de un vehiculo para asi reducir los costos de transporte y obtener mas ganancias.Requiere contar para esta oportunidad con 1,000 nuevos soles y proceder con la compra de abono orgánico esenciales para obtener mejores frutos.
texts.en:
Juan is 36 years old and is married to 33-year-old Delfina. They have three small children with whom they share the fruits of their effort and dedication. They share their family experiences in a home constructed from wood. Juan makes a living from the business of producing and maintaining organic cacao. He has been doing this for 15 years and he managed to start off in a fluid manner thanks to some plots of land he inherited from his parents in gratitude for his support from a very young age. As the years have passed, he has managed to get the maximum benefit from this business and has managed to acquire additional plots of land, thus improving his financial earnings.

He likes his work a lot, as owning his own land he prioritizes his work and provides better fruit to his clients. Nevertheless, the rainy season impairs and impedes the normal performance of his agricultural tasks. His long-term economic objectives point to the purchase of a vehicle in order to reduce the costs of transport and to increase earnings. For this opportunity he requires 1,000 Peruvian nuevos soles and to proceed with the purchase of organic fertilizer, essential for obtaining better fruit.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Ma.fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a scrap business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase more recycled materials to sell to a wholesaler.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is presenting Ma. Fe's business for funding of another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more recycled materials to sell to a wholesaler.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
This is Magdalena, She previously accessed a 35,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Magdalena hopes to expand her business and have more businesses. She dreams to have the strength to continue doing what she is doing. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed for her business.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert has owned a bakery for four years. He works hard in order to earn a living. Robert is married with four children; two of them go to school while two children are still infant-aged.

Robert wants to request a loan of 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos), allowing him to buy 10 bags of flour, 30 kilograms of sugar, and gallons of cooking oil for his bakery business. He knows that through this loan amount, he can further improve his financial stability, which enables him to educate his four children and have a comfortable lifestyle. Robert hopes and prays that his requested loan amount will be granted.

loans.use: to buy 10 bags of flour, 30 kilograms of sugar, and gallons of cooking oil for his bakery business.

loans.name: Vangie

texts.en:
This is Vangie. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used buy to more quantities of products like bananas, sweet potatoes, sugar and other ingredients needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to purchase bananas, sweet potatoes, sugar, oil and gas needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Vangie hopes to expand and have another stall. She dreams to give her children a good education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for bananas, sweet potatoes, sugar, oil and gas needed in her business.

loans.name: Codou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été fondé depuis le cycle premier du banc villageois il est composé de 6 femmes issues du même quartier et des quartiers environnants unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.
Madame Codou est une  veuve âgée de 50 ans et mère de 7 enfants dont 2 filles et 5 garçons, tous scolarisés.
Elle s'active dans le commerce de friperie depuis bientôt 20 ans et dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.
Elle est debout à l’extrême gauche de la photo la main levée habillée en grand boubou bleu blanc.
Son nouveau crédit de 500,000 francs cfa lui permettra d'acheter des balles de tissus qu'elle va revendre au détails au niveau du marché de son quartier. 
Les bénéfices réalisés par son activité lui permettront de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires scolaires et sanitaires de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was founded since the first cycle of the local "banc villageois" loan group. It consists of six women from the same and surrounding neighborhoods united through social and professional relationships.

Mrs. Codou is a widow aged 50 and the mother of seven children, two girls and five boys, all attending school. She has been active in the trade of used clothing for nearly 20 years and has a good experience in this field. She is standing at the far left of the photo raising her hand and dressed in a white and blue boubou.

Her new credit loan of 500,000 FCFA will enable her to buy bales of cloth she will sell at retail prices in her neighborhood's market. The profits generated by her business will allow her to take care of her children's educational, nutritional and health-related needs.

loans.use: buy bales of fabrics for small second-hand clothing commerce

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn is a 31-year-old married woman and a mother of three young children. They live in Bien Unido, Bohol. Ginalyn has been engaged in a fishing business for more than 15 years now. Her husband is her partner in the business.

Ginalyn is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, floaters, hooks and other items. With this, her husband will be able to enhance his catch, thus allowing them to sell more fish in the market.

In the future, Ginalyn has hopes of making her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, floaters, hooks and other items.

loans.name: Maruf

texts.en:
This loan will help Maruf be able to produce his wholesale retail items locally within the U.S. to eliminate international shipping costs and contribute more to his community. 

Originally from Bangladesh, Maruf always had dreams of establishing his own business. In 2008, Maruf opened Aadore International LLC., a storefront retail business that sells souvenir, novelty and home décor items. Maruf personalizes the goods and distributes them at wholesale costs across the U.S. and Caribbean. 
 
This loan will help Maruf purchase a laser cutting and engraving machine as well as a flatbed printer. By having these machines at his business location in Kissimmee, FL, Maruf will be able to produce and personalize new products himself, instead of outsourcing the work and shipping the items from China. 

Maruf hopes to grow his business to help create jobs for his local community and provide for his family.

View Maruf’s products online at http://www.aadoreinternational.com/

loans.use: To purchase a laser cutting and engraving machine and a flatbed printer

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a 60-year-old widow with eleven children.
Sonia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Sonia requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.
Sonia has been raising pigs for 40 years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.
In the future, Sonia would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 40 years old, married and has three children. With her spouse, they cook and sell pancit (noodles with vegetable toppings) for income. She has had this business for four years. Her income is used for meals and school fees. She would like to increase her sales and extend her good service, which is why she is asking for a loan of P 6,000 to buy soft drinks, vegetables and meat.
With the delicious food she sells, Nora will gain more customers and increase income as well and save for family's future expenses.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, vegetables and meat to make pancit.

loans.name: Ines

texts.en:
Ines is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. They live in Bien Unido, Bohol. She has engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for almost 15 years now. This is the source of their income.
Ines is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, and fuel for the boat. With this, they will be able to improve their fishing business and their income.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, and fuel for the boat.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta has been separated from her husband for thirteen years. She is now 60 years old and has five grown children. Vicenta is both father and mother to her five children.

Vicenta owns and run a retail store. She has been involved in this kind of business for thirteen years. With her determination to improve her financial stability, she is seeking a loan of PHP 15,000. She will use this amount to buy grocery items such as milk, sugar, soft drinks, cooking oil and soap for her retail store. She believes that her business will continue to expand, so she can save and be able to maintain both her hog raising business and retail store.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items such as milk, sugar, soft drinks, cooking oil and soap for her retail store.

loans.name: Morry

texts.en:
This is Morry. She previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more quantities of coconut. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to purchase more quantities of coconut. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Morry dreams to have more stalls where she can sell coconuts and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more quantities of coconut needed in her business.

loans.name: Scolastica's Group

texts.en:
Scolastica, who is in her 20s, is single and attending college training lessons part-time. For a period of two years now, she has had a food selling business. She is doing great with her business and studies as well. She performs her activities from 6 am to 4 pm daily and is able to generate a very good profit per month.

This will be her fourth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With her previous loans, which were all paid successfully, she managed to purchase more cooking items like some kilos of sugar, packets of salt, a sack of rice, baking flour and maize flour, and a bucket of cooking oil. With the extra profit earned, she will pay for tuition fees and home expenses. She will use this loan to buy more food items so as to offer more food services . She dreams of owning a wholesale shop .

She will share this loan with her loan group MBAYUWAYU, which totals 10 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more food items .

loans.name: Alfie Rose

texts.en:
Alfie Rose is 29 years old and married with three children.

Alfie Rose is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Alfie Rose requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Alfie Rose has been raising pigs for nine years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Arnest

texts.en: Arnest is a 47-year-old married man with eight children living in Kasese, Uganda. For 20 years now he has been teaching and he was inspired into service by his desire to serve his country,. Like most government employees, he is dissatisfied with the low salary he earns. His dream is to educate his children up to the University and see them work with reputable organizations. Arnest intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay for school fees

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 28 years old and lives in the town of Kijura in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past three years, Moses has been working hard to manage his produce business selling beans and maize flour . 

To help expand his business, Moses has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to expand the business and buy more beans and maize to sell. It will help Moses to generate greater profits and increase the family's income. Moses hopes that in the future, he will be able to develop the business . 

Moses is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Moses who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to buy more beans and maize to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 50 and lives in Malibay, Pasay City, Philippines. She operates a food stall. Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most families only eat home-cooked meals in the evenings when all of the family members are at home to eat. This is not only a case of tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to use cooking gas and food for just one or two people when buying cooked dishes costs less than raw food.  

Florence has decided to remain single and she manages her own house while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue running her business, Florence is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy more raw ingredients like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Florence dreams of helping her loved ones and other people. She hopes to be stronger in facing challenges in life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organised into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables, and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Evgenia

texts.en:
Evgenia is 56 years old. She lives in the Gurjaani district with her retired husband, two sons, one daughter and one daughter-in-law. She works in a lemonade factory and her sons are artisans working on private orders. They earn a small monthly income. 

The family owns a plot of land where they grow maize and sell it locally at the market. They also have one pig which will be sold for meat in the future.

With the requested loan Evgenia wants to develop her farming and buy three milk cows. She will milk them and make dairy products which will be sold locally at the markets. This will give her a greater monthly income and Evgenia will be able to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase milk cows to make dairy products.

loans.name: Fidelia's Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LOS ANGELES”  iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Fidelia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de rellenos, venta de medicamentos tradicionales, venta de juguetes, tejido de mantas, venta de comida

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Fidelia es integrante, ella indica que hace año y medio que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de servicio de transporte; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió por recomendación de su padre hace varios años atrás.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de llantas) que adquirirá de las tiendas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo implementará en su movilidad. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The "Los Angeles" communal bank is beginning its fifth cycle with Pro Mujer through the Collpani regional office.  This group has seven members and is run by a board which has Fidelia as its chairwoman.  The members have various types of businesses, including: selling stuffing, selling traditional medicines, selling toys, knitting blankets and selling food.

The loan this group is taking out will benefit the microbusinesses in the group which Fidelia is a member of.  She say that she joined Pro Mujer a year following an invitation from a friend who was already a member.  Fidelia currently has a transport business.  She tells us that she started this following a recommendation from her father some years ago.

Fidelia will use this loan to increase capital (buying tyres), which she will purchase from shops in the city La Paz. She will then use them on her vehicle.  This work allows Fidelia to earn the money to maintain her household as best as possible.  She is single and has a son.

When asked what she most likes about Pro Mujer Fidelia responds that she likes that health education that is offered.

loans.use: to buy tyres.

loans.name: Daysi

texts.es:
Daysi, administra una tienda de productos domésticos, trabaja desde las 5:00am hasta las 7:00pm, hasta la fecha no ha tenido inconvenientes.
Ella quiere comprarse productos de primera necesidad para mejorar el negocio, se comprara aceite, azúcar, pollo, queso, y otros que le sean útiles, para que los clientes encuentren lo necesario, este préstamo le servirá para fortalecer el negocio y las ventas, atrayendo las ganancias para ayudar a su familia.
Ella tiene el plan de hacer crecer el negocio, mejorar la vivienda entre otros junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Deysi has a shop selling domestic products.  She works from 5am until 7pm and, so far, she has had no problems.
Deysi would like to buy staple goods in order to improve the business. She will buy oil, sugar, chicken, cheese and other useful products so that customers can find what they need.  This loan will help Deysi to strengthen the business and sales, bringing higher profits to help her family.
Deysi's plan is to grow the business and improve her home with her family.

loans.use: to buy oil, sugar, chicken and cheese.

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es:
Yesenia, se decidió por otro préstamo, para la compra de maíz que utiliza en la elaboración de las tortillas, ella necesita comprarse el maíz  y además la leña, esto le ayudara para mejorar el servicio aumentando su producción, tambien el préstamo le permite realizar la compra a mejor precio. 
Con el préstamo anterior ella tuvo una experiencia positiva,  logro estabilizar sus ventas, sus ingresos son para la subsistencia de la familia, cubriendo lo más necesario.
texts.en:
Yesenia has decided to take out another loan to buy corn that she will use for making tortillas.  She needs to buy corn and also firewood.  This will help her to improve the service she offers and increase production.  The loan would also help Yesenia to make her purchases at a better price.

Yesenia had a very positive experience with her previous loan.  She managed to make her sales and income more stable for sustaining the family and covering necessary costs.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, trabaja en el cultivo de maíz. El tiene 31 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida, sus 2 hijos de edades de 2 y 5 años también habitan con ellos sus padres.
El tiene 7 años de trabajar en lo propio  realizándolo con su padre de lunes a sábado en los horarios de 6:00 am a 12:00 md, esta actividad le permite tener ingresos para ayudar a su familia con los gastos. El requiere un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de 3 sacos de abonos. Dicha compra le ayudara a realizar la siembra con los cuidados necesarios.
La inversión le permitirá obtener mejores ingresos a través de la producción del cultivo y así mejorar las condiciones de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Juan makes a living growing corn.  He is 31 years old and lives with his partner and two children, who are aged 2 and 5 years old.  He also lives with his parents.

Juan has been doing this work for seven years alongside his father.  They work from 6am until midday.  This work allows Juan to earn an income to help with household costs.  He needs a loan to buy three bags of fertiliser.  This purchase will help him to plant his crops and give them the necessary care.

This investment will allow Juan to earn a higher income through his crop and so improve his and his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy three bags of fertiliser.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Arlene works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling seaweeds in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing.  Arlene is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more seaweeds to sell for her seaweeds business.

Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more seaweeds to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rorng

texts.en:
Rorng is 38 and a resident living with her husband and four children in Krong Siem Reap, Siem Reap province. Rorng and her husband operate a selling businesses to generate additional income besides a farming business during the rainy season. Rorng cooks and sells food that is normally eaten by drinkers while her husband sells bread through traveling sales. And at the same time, they are managing their household. Through their hardships, this couple is able to make approximately 11 USD per day to provide for their everyday expenses.

To help her continue operations of her farming business, she is requesting a loan of 1,500 USD to cover the costs for planting potatoes and soybeans. She believes that the loan will boost her income as she strives to work and has financial supports. She wants to help her children in their education with a small amount of savings that she has saved regularly and reserved for their future.

loans.use: to cover the costs for planting potatoes and soybeans

loans.name: Francisco Jeronimo

texts.es: Don Francisco de 42 años de edad vive con su mama en casa propia, el posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, maiz, leche, huevos, entre otros, con su negocio le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, su tienda esta ubicada en su lugar de residencia, es responsable y trabajador el credito que solicita es para la compra de mas productos para la tienda y poder tenerla surtida con lo que sus clientes necesitan y poder seguir teniendo mas ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Francisco, 42 years old, lives with his mother in their own house. He owns a store where he sells consumer staples, such as beans, corn, milk, and eggs, among others. His business allows him to make better earnings. His shop is located in his home. He is responsible and hardworking. 

The loan he is asking for is to buy more products for his store, so that he can keep it stocked with everything his customers need, and to be able to continue to increase his earnings to achieve a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy bulk grains.

loans.name: Maileen Rose

texts.en:
This is Maileen Rose. She previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Maileen Rose dreams that her business will continue to grow and expand. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy land for farming

loans.name: Twaha

texts.en:
Twaha is 50 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has 6 children who are all currently in school. For the past 5 years, Twaha has been working hard to manage his motor spare parts business, which sells motorcycle spare parts. 

To help expand his business, Twaha has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add into business and to buy more motor spare parts, and will help Twaha to generate greater profits and buy better machines for welding. Twaha hopes that in the future he will be able to transform into a workshop. 

Twaha is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Twaha who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to add into business and to buy more motor spare parts

loans.name: Julieta Concepcion

texts.es: La señora Julieta M.M habita en el municipio de Masaya en la comunidad Pilas Orientales, su esposo es Albañil y le apoya en todos los gastos y  decisiones del hogar, tienen tres hijos los cuales estudian en la actualidad, ella Cultiva Yuca desde hace varios años, con este nuevo financiamiento comprara Insumos para darle un optimo Mantenimiento a su cultivo. comprara: Urea, Completo, Madera para establecer una parte de la Yuca y paga Mano de Obra para limpieza de los siembros, Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han Brindado.
texts.en:
Julieta M.M. lives in the town of Masaya in the community of Pilas Orientales. Her husband is a bricklayer, and supports her with all of their expenses and household decisions. They have three children who are currently students. 

She has been growing yucca for years, and with this new loan she will buy inputs to optimize her farming. She will buy different fertilizers and wood to sow some of the yucca and pay for labour to clean the crops. She is thankful for the support that Afodenic and Kiva have given her.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to maintain her crops.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
This is Aida. Her previous loan was a big help to her business. She was able to buy all the ingredients she needed for her grocery store. She has had this business for 23 years now. In addition to her variety store, she also operates a food stall and repackages products to earn additional income. Aida and her husband are working hard to provide income to meet their daily needs.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in additional profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial addition with a glad and thankful heart.

Aida dreams of having a bigger store for her growing business and hopes that her family will always stick together. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from her studies of the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Flor's Group

texts.es: Saludos  desde Perú,   Un grupo conformado por 9 mujeres   emprendedoras    y con mucha creatividad para los negocios. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal “La Cruz De Yerbateros” una de ellas es la Sra. Flor de 43 años de edad casada  y madre de  1 hijo, ella se dedica diariamente a la venta de tamales(comida tipica de la zona),  el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de educación de sus hijo, Su mayor deseo es de terminar de construir su vivienda y  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus tamales  y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. . Solicitó el préstamo para la compra de ollas y platos para su negopcio, pues la demanda ha aumentado y necesita de mayores utensilios para la venta de tamales, a la vez  la Sra. Flor  y todos los integrantes se encuentran agradecidos   con Kiva y Edaprospo por el préstamo otorgado    y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas su metas propuestas.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru!

A group made up of nine entrepreneurial women with much creativity for business. These women form the communal bank group called "La Cruz de Yerbateros" (The Cross of Herbalists). One of these members is Flor, a 43-three-year old woman. Flor is married and has one son. She makes a living selling tamales (a typical food in this region). This business helps her to pay her son's education expenses.

Flor's biggest dream is to finish the construction on her home. In the future she would like to have her own stall from which to sell her tamales and increase her profits.

Flor is requesting this loan in order to buy pots and plates for her business. Demand for her tamales has been increasing and she needs better utensils for her tamale business. 

Flor and the other members of this group are very grateful to Kiva and Edaprospo for this loan and the confidence shown in this group. The pledge to complete all of their proposed goals.

loans.use: to buy pots and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Phally's Group

texts.en:
Phally, 43, is married with five children. She resides in a rural village located in the Kandal province of Sa Ang district, Cambodia. Three of her children are dependent on her and still in school. For the last 25 years, she has farmed rice, which is the primary source of her family’s income. Her husband works as a construction worker in their local area to earn additional income. The business currently earns her about 5,600 KHR to meet the family’s needs.
She has just started borrowing with VisionFund this cycle. Now she is leading a group of three to ask for a loan from VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion of the loan to buy materials to build a proper latrine. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a clean latrine to use in order to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy materials to build a proper latrine

loans.name: Bayardo Antonio

texts.es: El señor Bayardo habita enel  municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a sus hijos, el es contratista de Construccion y a trabajado duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos y darles un hogar digno y con optimas condiciones, para el es dificil recaudar de una sola vez el dinero para la compra de materiales y continuar con su  gran sueño que es tener su casa propia, con este  nevo financiamiento comprara lo necesario como: Cemento, Arena. Perlines, Zinc, Piedrin. Agradece a Afodenic y Fondos Kiva por la confianza y apoyo brindado
texts.en:
Bayardo lives, together with his children, in the municipality of Ticuantepe. He works as a construction contractor. Bayardo works hard in order to help his children get ahead and provide them with a dignified home with the best conditions possible. 

It is difficult for Bayardo to gather enough money together at one time to purchase materials and continue working toward his dream of owning a house. With this new loan, he will buy some necessary items such as cement, sand, metal beams, zinc, and piedrin. 

Bayardo is grateful to Afodenic and Kiva for the confidence they have put in him and the help they've offered.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.es: La señora Rafaela, habita en una de las comunidades del municipio de Ticuantepe llamado San Jose de los Rios, junto a su esposo quien es Albañil trabajan mucho para poder darle a sus hijos las condiciones optima. con este nuevo financiamiento compraran los Insumos y Fertilizantes necesarios para darle mantenimiento a su cultivo de piña comprara: Urea, Completo, Triple etc. asi su cosecha sera de calidad y la plaga no le ocacionara problemas. Agradece a Afodenic y Fondos Kiva por la oportunida  nuevamente brindada y el apoyo que le han dado estos años.
texts.en:
Rafaela lives, together with her husband, in a community in the municipality of Ticuantepe called San Jose de los Rios. Her husband works in construction. Both he and Rafaela work hard to give their children the best they can. With this new loan, she will buy the supplies and fertilizers necessary to maintain her pineapple crops. These include urea, Completo, Triple, and other products. With these Rafaela will improve the quality of her crop and she will ward off infestation. 

She is very grateful to Afodenic and Kiva for this new opportunity and the support they have offered her over the years.

loans.use: to buy supplies to maintain her crops.

loans.name: Sylvia's Group

texts.en:
Sylvia's group is composed of two hardworking women. Sylvia is 21 years old and lives in the town of Bombo in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom are currently in school. For the past four years, Sylvia has been working hard to manage her clothing store, which sells ladies' and men's clothes. 

To help her to expand her business, Sylvia has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes to sell and will help Sylvia to generate greater profits. Sylvia hopes that, in the future, she will be able to enhance the business. 

Sylvia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Van's Group

texts.en:
Van is 51 years old and lives in a rural area of the Sa Ang district. She has five children. She is a rice farmer. She has been in her current line of work for 33 years and earns about 9,000 KHR per day. This allows her to save about 2,000 KHR a day after paying her daily expenses.

Van’s group consists of four members who live in the same village. This is her first cycle with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Van is going to use her portion of this loan to build a latrine because this will allow her family to have a healthier and cleaner life.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Lizeth Areli

texts.es: la Señora Areli de 36 años de edad vive con su esposo en casa propia, vende pupusas en su lugar de residencia desde hace 4 años, solicita el credito para seguir trabajando, debido a que tiene mucha demanda ya que no hay otra pupuseria en el lugar y asi poder solventar todos sus gastos en el hogar.
texts.en: Areli, 36 years old and lives with her husband in their own home. She has been selling stuffed tortillas from home for 4 years. She is asking for a loan in order to continue working, because there is a high demand as there are no other nearby stuffed tortilla stands and so she can deal with all the household expenses.

loans.use: to have working capital for her home based stuffed tortilla stand

loans.name: Srouy's Group

texts.en:
Srouy, 47, lives in a rural area of the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Cambodia. To support the family, he has been farming rice and working for others for a fee for 29 years. Srouy and his wife can earn about 10,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Srouy is now leading his group for the first microloan with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. Srouy, who is the leader, will use his portion to buy materials for building a proper latrine. He thereby hopes to have a hygienic latrine for his family to use.

loans.use: To buy materials for building a proper latrine.

loans.name: Bon Berger 2 Group

texts.en:
Sylvie, age 44, is single with two children, 16 and 24 years old. They are both attending school currently. She is representing the Bon Berger 2 group. 

Sylvie owns a butcher shop in Brazzaville. She has had this business for three years. She will use the loan to buy boxes of beef and other fresh foods like chicken, pork, and fish. Her business strategy is to eventually open a second and third shop. 

Sylvie has received five previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. She has a good repayment record. She wants to grow her business and continue taking loans from HOPE Congo. She feels the loans help her business and make her a good manager. 

She hopes her children will finish school and be able to travel outside of Congo.

loans.use: to pay for boxes of beef and fresh meats.

loans.name: Jaqueline  Boye's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été créé depuis le cycle premier du banc villageois et regroupe 18 femmes du même village unies par de bonnes relations sociales.

Madame Marie Madeleine, la représentante ,est une femme mariée âgée de 46 ans et mère de 6 enfants dont 3 filles et 3 garçons tous scolarisés.
Elle est debout à l’extrême gauche de la photo la main levée et vêtu d'un boubou fleurette. Elle s'active dans le commerce de porcs depuis longtemps et dispose d'une grande expérience.
Son nouveau crédit de 200,000 francs cfa lui permettra d'acheter des porcs qu'elle va élever et revendre au détails au niveau de son village et des villages environnants.
les bénéfices réalisés par son activité lui permettront de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires scolaires et sanitaires de ses enfants et de renforcer ses épargnes au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group was created during the first cycle of the banc villageois and includes 18 woman from the same village who share good social relationships.

Marie Madeleine, the representative of the group, is a married, 46-year-old woman who is a mother of six children, of whom three are girls and three are boys. All the children go to school. Marie Madeleine is standing on the very left of the photo with her hand raised, wearing a flowered dress. 

She has been selling pigs for a long time and has been having a good experience with it. Her new loan of 200,000 francs CFA will allow her to buy pigs that she is going to raise and then resell in her village and surrounding villages. 

The earnings from this work will allow her to provide for the dietary, school, and health needs of her children and increase her savings in the banc villageois.

loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es: Don Gilberto de 61 años de edad vive con un familiar en casa propia trabaja de agricultor y tiene cultivos de maiz, frijol y maicillo, con lo que vende de sus productos lleva el sustento a su hogar, solicita un credito para seguir mejorando su cosecha y poder tener mas ventas y mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Gilberto is 61 years old and lives at home with family in their own home. 

He works as a farmer growing corn, beans and sorghum, selling the products in order to provide for the family. 

He is asking for a loan in order to continue improving his harvest by having more sales and profits.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Bon Berger 1 Group

texts.en:
Medard, age 59, is married and has six children, 16 to 27 years old. Three are currently attending school. He is representing the Bon Berger 1 group.

Medard sells manioc in bulk to vendors in Brazzaville.(Manioc is made from the roots of the Cassava plant and is a staple food in most Congolese homes.) He has been operating this business for over 10 years. He will use the loan to buy a field's worth of manioc. His business strategy is to sell the manioc in bulk to his vendors. He is able to move large amounts of product and his customers are happy to buy in bulk.
 
Medard has received five previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. He has a good repayment record. He wants to continue to grow and have a large business in the future.

loans.use: to pay for manioc.

loans.name: Channa's Group

texts.en:
Channa is from a rural village in the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Cambodia. She is 45 years old and she is a widow. 

Channa has been involved in fish catching. Engaging in this business for 25 years, she is able to earn about KHR 10,000 per day and manages to save about KHR 3,000 each day, after daily expenses.
 
This is Channa's first microloan with VisionFund Cambodia. As the group loan leader, she is going to use her portion to buy materials to construct a decent latrine. She'll need cement, bricks, a latrine pan, etc. Channa hopes that this loan will enable her family to have a clean latrine for daily use, so as to improve a healthy standard of living.

loans.use: To buy materials to construct a decent latrine.

loans.name: Seynabou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été fondé depuis la création du banc villageois et regroupe 17 femmes du quartier unies par de bonnes relations de voisinages et professionnelles.

La responsable madame Yaram  est une femme mariée âgée de 51 ans et mère de 5 filles dont la plus âgée a 30 ans et la cadette 18 ans.
Elle est debout à l’extrême gauche de la photo habillée d'un boubou fleuris la main levée. 
Madame s'active dans le commerce de vêtements ou friperie.
Avec son nouveau crédit  de 70,000 francs cfa elle va acheter des balles de friperie qu'elle va revendre au détail au niveau du marché de sa localité.
les bénéfices réalisés lui permettront de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires et sanitaires de ses enfants et de renforcer ses épargnes personnelles au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group was founded at the same time as the banc villageois and includes 17 women who live in the same area and share good neighborhood and professional ties. The leader of the group, Yaram, is a married, 51-year-old woman and a mother of five girls, who range from 30 to 18 years old. Yaram is standing at the very left in the photo and is dressed in a flowery dress with her hand raised. 

Yaram sells clothing or used clothing. With this new loan of 70,000 francs CFA, she is going to buy bales of used clothing that she is going to resell in her local market. 

The earnings from this business will allow her to provide for the dietary and health needs of her children and increase her personal savings in the band villageois.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothing

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.es: La señora Ana, habita en el municipio de la Concepcion, junto a su familia, ella trabaja como demestica para una casa particular su mayor dificultad es el no poder reunir de una sola vez el dinero para la compra de los Materiales que  necesita, con este nuevo financiamiento comprar: Piedras, Cemento, Arena, Hierro, etc con esto continuara con la construccion de su casa. Agradece a Afodenic y Fondos Kiva por la confianza brindada
texts.en:
Ana lives in the town of Concepción with her family. She works as a domestic worker in a private home. 

Her greatest difficulty is not being able to to gather together at one time the money to buy supplies she needs. With this new loan she will buy stones, cements, sand, iron, etc. and with this she will continue the construction of her home. 

She is grateful to Afodenic and the Kiva lenders for the trust provided.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Somaly's Group

texts.en:
Somaly, 23, is married and has one son. Her family lives in a house with a thatched roof located in Kandal province’s Sa Ang district, and the main source of her family’s income is selling groceries in her village. She has been running her business for several years, earning about KHR 12,000 per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Somaly is just with VisionFund this cycle. She is leading her group of three to ask for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy materials for building a decent latrine, such as a latrine bowl, tile draining, etc. Somaly hopes this loan will enable her family to have a healthy latrine and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy materials for building a decent latrine.

loans.name: Izolda

texts.en:
Izolda is 44 years old. She lives in the Gurjaani district with her 53-year-old husband, Nodar, and two sons who are going to school. The family owns a vineyard, and they also have 2 milk cows, 2 calves and a pig which will be sold as meat in the future. Izolda is milking cows every day to make dairy products, which is sold locally at the markets, and they get a small monthly income from the sales. 

With the requested loan she wants to purchase an egg incubator. She will buy eggs to incubate chicks and after one month sell them locally at the markets. Izolda already has experience in this field and she thinks it will be profitable to renew the business. This will increase the family income, and with the profit she wants to renovate their house to have better living conditions, and to provide for her sons' future education.

loans.use: To purchase an egg incubator to incubate chicks.

loans.name: Gorreti's' Group

texts.en:
Gorreti's group is composed of four hardworking women. Gorreti  is 18 years old and lives in the town of Luwero in the Luwero region of Uganda. For the past three years, Gorreti  has been working hard to manage her vegetable stall. 

To help expand her business, Gorreti  has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more different vegetables to sell, and it will help Gorreti to generate greater profits and pay school tuition for her sister. Gorreti hopes that in the future she will be able to look after her siblings. 

Gorreti  is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more different vegetables to sell.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 23 years old. He lives in Chiatura District with his parents. George has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

George is a dentist and he is working in a local clinic where he gets a small monthly salary. His father is retired and gets a pension. Also, his mother is an invalid and gets a small monthly payment from the government. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category.
