George requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, George wants to rent a place to start a dental clinic locally. He will purchase all the needed dental equipment and operative supplies. George hopes his business will be profitable as he already has his clients from the current job. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will increase his income and his family members will be able to increase their spending to satisfy their daily needs, in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To start a dental clinic locally.

loans.name: Ndoumbe's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe existe depuis le 07/07/11 date de création du Banc Villageois . Il est composé de 16 femmes qui habite dans le même village . 

La responsable du groupe Ndoumbé est une femmes mariée, mère de 4 enfants ( 3 garçons et 1fille) . 
Elle s'active dans l'élevage de moutons et dans la vente de fruits et légumes au marché du village .

Avec les bénéfices obtenus, elle espére pouvoir développer son épargne et diversifier son activité.
texts.en:
The group was founded at the same time as the banc villages on July 7, 2011. The group is composed of 16 women who live in the same village. 

The leader of the group, Ndoumbe, is a married woman and a mother of four children (three boys and one girl). She practices sheep farming and also sells fruits and vegetables in the village market. 

With the earnings received, she hopes to be able to increase her savings and diversify her business.

loans.use: to buy sheep for sheep farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase building materials.

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Pov, 43 years old, lives in a rural area in the Sa Ang district, Kandal province. She is married and has five children, three of whom are dependent and still in school. Pov and her children have been engaged in farming rice and catching fish for 23 years. Her family’s daily income is about KHR 8,000 per day, but they can manage to save about KHR 2,000 each day, after deducting daily expenses.
 
Pov has just joined with VisionFund Cambodia this cycle. Now, she is leading a group of three to request a loan. As the leader, Pov will use her portion to buy materials, such as a latrine bowl, tile and sewage drains to build a proper latrine. She hopes this loan will enable her family to have an improved life.

loans.use: To buy materials to build a proper latrine.

loans.name: Na God Dae Gee Group

texts.en:
Adama is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Adama was born in Tankoro in eastern Sierra Leone 38 years ago. She is married to a driver, and the couple has 5 children who are attending secondary and primary schools. Adama sells market foods - palm-oil (the country's most popular cooking oil), onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), pepper, tomatoes, rice, etc. She has been doing business for years now. 

With the help of this loan, Adama and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Adama will use her share of the loan to buy palm-oil, onions, margi, pepper, tomatoes, rice, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy palm-oil, onions, margi, pepper, tomatoes, rice, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is from Tiribe, Kenya. She is married and they have four young children who are in school. They both strive to get ahead and provide their children with everything they did not have.

Fatuma has a food pantry in her house. Thanks to the good variety she offers, she has been able to establish a good clientele. She is a hardworking individual and says that she wants to continue growing in her current profession. For this reason, she strives to do her best.

Fatuma is requesting this loan so that she can invest in the purchase of beverages, milk, bread, noodles, rice, vegetables, and other products so that she can continue offering her customers the variety that they are accustomed to having.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, milk, bread, noodles, rice, vegetables, and other products.

loans.name: Blanca Lydia

texts.es: Doña Blanca de 56 años de edad vive con su hija en casa propia, es una mujer muy responsable, trabajadora y honrada, trabaja en su propia panadería en la que elabora pan dulce, y sale a venderlo por la colonia donde ella reside solicita un préstamo para invertir en la compra de harina, manteca, latas y todo lo necesario para poder producir más. Este proyecto de mejoramiento para su panadería es muy importante para ella puesto que así mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Blanca is 56 years old. She lives with her daughter in her own home. She is a very responsible, hardworking, and honest woman. 

She works in her own bakery making pastries, and she sells throughout the neighborhood where she lives. 

She is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of flour, butter, containers, and everything that’s needed to to able to produce more. This undertaking of improvement for the bakery is very important for her because she will be improving her quality of life as well as that of her family.

loans.use: to have working capital to invest in necessary supplies for her bakery

loans.name: Aidah's Group

texts.en:
Aidah's group is comprised of 5 hardworking women. She is 21 years old and lives in the town of Bombo in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who are both currently in school. For the past 5 years, Aidah has been working hard to manage her vegetable stall, where she sells vegetables. 

To help expand her business, Aidah has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase vegetables to sell, and will help Aidah to generate greater profits and increase the income level of the family. She hopes that in the future she will be able to be more productive. 

Aidah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene's group is comprised of hardworking women. She is 18 years old and lives in the town of Bombo in the Luwero region of Uganda. For the past 3 years, Irene has been working hard to manage her soft drinks business, which sells fresh juices. 

To help expand her business, Irene has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more soft drinks such as soda, water and passion juice to sell, and will help Irene to generate more income. She hopes that in the future she will be able to get more profits from the business. 

Irene is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, such as soda, water and passion juice to sell.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is from Tiribe, Mombasa. She is married and has five children. Although her children are small, they are the reason that Dama and her husband struggle for success.

Dama has a business selling fruits and vegetables at the town market. She occupies two stands. She has a fixed customer base, good income, and good business and personal references. She is a hardworking woman and an excellent client.

She is asking for this loan to purchase fruits and vegetables. This will enable her to stock her store with products and to continue giving her customers the quality they expect from her.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is a 59-year-old woman living with her husband in the Gurjaani district. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have a calf and two milk cows. Leila milks cows and produces dairy products to sell at local markets at a good price. Besides that, the family owns an agricultural plot of land where they have a vineyard, which is looked after by Leila’s husband. Leila also purchases secondhand clothes from the wholesalers to resell with a price markup to her villagers. 

With one part of the requested loan Leila wants to renovate a cattle shed. The renovated shed will give her the opportunity to purchase more cattle. Another part of the loan will be used to buy more secondhand clothes that she will sell for a good price and develop her business. This will help the couple to make their living conditions better.

loans.use: To buy more secondhand clothes and to renovate her shed.

loans.name: Sisters Of Destiny Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Sisters of Destiny” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 3,300,000 SLL for the entire group in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Sallamatu is the featured leader of this group. She is a 39-year-old and she is married with 5 children – 1 in primary school, 3 in secondary school and 1 not yet of school-going age. Sallamatu sells charcoal and firewood. She has been doing this type of business for 15 years now. With the help of this loan, she will buy a large quantity of charcoal and firewood to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of charcoal and firewood to add to her business.

loans.name: Festus

texts.en: Festus is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. He owns a small, well-stocked grocery store where he works very hard every day. He’s had his small business for 2 years and thanks to his work and sacrifice it’s been growing. He also relates that his wife always helps him in everything she can and they are growing this way. Festus requests the loan to buy milk, bread, meats, beverages and other products needed to stock the store to continue growing and providing customers with everything they need.

loans.use: to buy milk, bread, meats, beverages and other products

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is a married woman and has 4 children. She lives in her own home and must work hard to support her children, which she does with effort and sacrifice.

Mlongo has her own business as the proprietor of a shop where she sells foodstuffs. In addition, she also does farming. Over time, she has been able to cater to a diverse clientele, thanks to the quality of her work.

With this loan, Mlongo wants to buy what she needs to run her business, so she needs sacks of maize for resale.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize for resale.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha has been a merchant for more than 1 year. She is hardworking and dedicated. Asha is married and has seven children. Thanks to all of her efforts, her children are studying. She says that she never had the opportunity to study. Therefore, her greatest wish is to see all of her children become professionals so that they can have a better future.

Asha is engaged in retail and has a well-stocked food pantry that supplies goods to the people in her neighborhood. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy sacks of maize and other items of basic necessity so that she can restock her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of maize and other items of basic necessity so that she can restock her business.

loans.name: Zoia

texts.en:
Zoia is 38 years old. She lives in Chiatura District with her husband, Zurab, and two children who are going to school. Zoia requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The family owns a small agricultural plot of land which Zurab cultivates and sows maize. The harvested product is sold locally at the market, and the family has a very small monthly income. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Zoia requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Zoia will purchase cheese at wholesale prices and sell it locally at the market with a price mark-up. She plans to reinvest the profit in the same business. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will give Zoia and her husband the opportunity to improve their family living conditions and provide for their children's future education.

loans.use: To purchase cheese at wholesale prices to sell later with a price mark-up.

loans.name: Halima's Group

texts.en:
Halima's group is comprised of 2 hardworking women. Halima is 22 years old and lives in the town of Maganjo in the Luwero region of Uganda. For the past 5 years, she has been working hard to manage her business of making clothes. 

To help expand her business, Halima has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy an electric sewing machine, and will help her to generate greater profits and increase sales. She hopes that in the future she will be able build a house of her own.  

Halima is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy an electric sewing machine.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah has made a living selling agricultural products for the past 15 years. She has a well-established base of customers that always buy products from her because of their good quality.

Annah is asking for a loan to purchase cassava for her daily sales, and she will also be purchasing fruits and vegetables to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase cassava and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 2 years old. He is married and lives with his 32-year-old wife Tamar in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia. George requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. Nowadays, the only source of the income for the family is the monthly salary of Tamar. She works as a record producer at the local TV company. 

George requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the frames of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, George will open a cafe. He has already rented a place where he plans to open a cafe. He will pay for all the costs of what will be needed for repairing it to be attractive for his clients. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to open a cafe

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a photocopier for his business.

loans.name: Viola's Group

texts.en:
Viola's group is comprised of 3 hardworking women. Viola is 20 years old and lives in the town of Mangajo in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 4 years, Viola has been working hard to manage her business, which sells mobile phone accessories. 

To help expand her business, Viola has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more phone accessories such as phone chargers to sell, and will help Viola to generate greater profits and earn money to put her children through school. Viola hopes that in the future she will be able to sell a large variety of accessories. 

Viola is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more phone accessories such as phone chargers to sell.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina de 62 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora y con muchos deseos por cumplir. Con sacrificio y dedicación a logrado montar su taller de confección en donde elabora todo tipo de prendas. Trabaja todos los días de 8 de la mañana a 6 de la tarde. Su mayor sueño es poder ampliar su negocio y generar fuentes de empleo a mujeres cabeza de familia, ya que le tocó padecer el sufrimiento de educar a sus cuatro hijos, cuando su esposo falleció. Es conciente de la difícil situación que padecen millones de mujeres y por eso está convencida que a través de su labor puede aliviar la carga de muchas de ellas.

En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos como telas, agujas e hijos con el fin de aumentar su producción y mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is 62 years old. She is a working woman with many desires to fulfill. Through sacrifice and dedication she has successfully started a tailoring business where she makes all types of outfits.

She works every day from 8:00 in the morning until 6:00 in the evening. Her biggest dream is to be able to expand her business and generate employment for women who are head of households, because of of the suffering she went through to educate her four children, when her husband died. She is aware of the difficult situation that millions of women suffer and this is why she believes that through her work she can help lighten the burden of many of them.

She is asking for a loan to buy supplies such as fabric, needles and thread in order to expand her production and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, needles and thread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his carpentry shop's operations by purchasing additional sandpaper, timber, and vanish.

loans.name: Niyuga

texts.en:
Niyuga is a merchant. She makes a living selling mainly fruits and vegetables. She has done this work for more than 10 years.  She has a place in a popular market in Tiribe where she sells fresh products to her customers every day.

She's a very hardworking person who makes an effort every day from very early in the morning, because she begins her work day very early.

She's requesting this loan to be able to buy fruits and vegetables so she can continue working and giving her customers good products.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es:
María Dolores de 47 años de edad, se ha caracterizado en su municipio por ser una mujer luchadora. Con esmero y esfuerzo ha logrado sacar a sus tres hijos adelante. En su caminar ha tenido que afrontar grandes retos que le han enseñado a ver y a vivir la vida con madurez.
Asegura que sus hijos son su prioridad y todas sus luchas han sido para ofrecerles un mejor bienestar.
Con su valentía logró colocar en su vivienda una tienda en donde comercializa productos de la canasta familiar, a fin de generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento del hogar debido a que es madre soltera.
Su mayor sueño es poder adquirir una vivienda para mejorar sus condiciones de vida, por lo cual le apuesta a su negocio y desea realizar una inversión en surtido y la compra de una nevera para mejorar su calidad en el servicio y generar un mayor número de ventas que le permitan ahorrar el dinero suficiente para dar la cuota inicial de su casa. María no cuenta con el dinero para realizar dicha inversión, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito para comenzar a materializar su sueño.
texts.en:
María Dolores is 47 years old and has become known in her town for being a determined woman.  With care and effort, she has managed to help her three children move forward.  María has had to face big challenges and they have taught her how to be mature in life.
She says her children are her biggest priority in life and everything she has fought for has been to give her children a better life.
María has bravely opened up a shop in her home where she sells staple foods in order to generate more necessary income to sustain her household, where she is a single mother.
Her biggest dream is to buy a home to improve her living conditions and so she relies on her business and wants to invest in buying more stock and a fridge so as to improve the quality of service and generate more sales.  This will allow her to save enough money to put a down payment on her house.  María does not have her own money to invest in her business so she is applying for this loan so she can start to make her dream a reality.

loans.use: to buy a new fridge and staple foods.

loans.name: Sia Hawa

texts.en: Greetings are coming to you from Sia, a Kiva borrower from the city of Koidu, in eastern Sierra Leone. Having repaid her last Kiva loan successfully, Sia is humbly requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 Sierra Leonean leones in order to further expand her business. Her first Kiva loan made a very huge impact in her business and personal well-being. She was able to make more sales, earn a better profit, and repay the loan. Sia also used the profit she made to buy a plot of land for the future construction of a house and a motor-bike taxi. Though sometimes sales are slow and she faces some bad debtors, Sia is very grateful to you as the previous loan has tremendously improved her business. Sia is requesting a new loan to buy more jewelry to add to her current stock. It is Sia's dream to increase her business inventory to a level such that she will no longer ask for loans from SMT/Kiva lenders, and she will proudly conduct her business with her own money.

loans.use: to buy additional jewelry items to add to her existing stock

loans.name: Samini

texts.en: Samini has a grocery store. He is asking for another loan to buy noodles, flour, cooking oil, herbs, cookies, cassava, drinks, and candy, among other things, to stock his store so that he can offer a greater variety to his customers and be able to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy noodles, flour, cooking oil, herbs, cookies, cassava, drinks, and candy to stock his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of clothes and cloths to add to her current stock

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia Bentsiwa Aiddo is married and has 2 children.  She has received schooling through junior high school.  Cecilia sells cooked rice in Peofofordo near Abura and has done this for the past 12 years.  She also works part time as a seamstress in her community and her work is very well respected. 

However, she is taking out this loan to improve her cooked rice enterprise.  Her husband works as a security guard.  Cecilia uses her income to help support her husband with their children’s school fees and other family expenses.  Cecilia will use the loan to purchase more rice to prepare and sell in the market.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Cecilia plans to expand her food selling business further.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to prepare and sell in the market.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia  is a single mother of four children and all of her children go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members (parents and sister).  

She has a pub business and has been in this business for seven years, selling to all categories of people on a retail bassis.  She has applied for a loan of 500,000/=Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more crates of beer, soda and boxes of mineral water.   

Her major business challenge includes transportation, thieves and seasonality.   She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and to also own a fully stocked pub.  She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses includes rent for her business premise and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer, soda and boxes of mineral water.

loans.name: Clara Araba

texts.en:
Clara Araba is married and has 1 child.  She has received schooling through junior high school.  Clara Araba sells a variety of foods from her food stall in Peofofordo near Abura.  Some of her most popular items include chips, biscuits and candy treats.   Clara has done this work for 7 years. 

Her husband is a teacher.  Clara Araba uses her income to help support her husband with their general expenses and to save for their future.  Clara Araba will use the loan to purchase an increased quantity and variety of food to sell to meet her customer’s demands.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Clara Araba plans to grow her food stall.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity and variety of foods to sell

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is a widow and has 4 children.  She has received no formal education.  Ama sells the local favorite dish, fante kenkey, in Peofofordo near Abura, which she has done for the past 45 years.  Fante kenkey is a mashed, fermented, corn dough that is usually wrapped in banana leaves and sold in local markets. 

Ama uses her income to support herself and help her adult children whenever she can.  Ama will use the loan to purchase an increased quantity of corn to prepare her fante kenkey recipe.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to grow her fante kenkey enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of corn to prepare her fante kenkey recipe.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha es una mujer de 58 años, quien se dedicó a las labores del hogar y a velar por el bienestar de su familia. Después de que su hijo creció, ella decidió dedicarse a la comercialización de flores en su municipio con el propósito de mejorar los ingresos en su hogar. Con el desarrollo de la actividad, ha mejorado las condiciones de vida de su familia y desea poder expandir su negocio para convertirlo en una microempresa familiar. Por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará para la compra de flores y la adecuación del local. Espera seguir creciendo con su actividad y convertirse en una fuente de empleo, ayudando a mujeres cabeza de familia.
texts.en:
Martha, a 58 year old woman, works taking care of the house and looking after the welfare of her family. After her son grew up, she decided to work selling flowers in her municipality in order to improve her household income.

As the activity has grown, the quality of life of her family has improved and she wants to expand her business making it a family micro-enterprise. This is why she is asking for a loan to use to buy flowers and fitting out a facility.

She hopes to continue to grow the business and to become a source of employment, helping women who are heads of households.

loans.use: to buy flowers and fitting out a facility

loans.name: Nora Lucía

texts.es:
Nora de 50 años, es una mujer motivada por el deseo de ver sus cuatro hijos realizando sus estudios de educación superior. Cuenta uno de sus sueños fue ingresar a la universidad pero debido a las carencias económicas de su familia su sueño no se convirtió en realidad, por lo cual desea que sus hijos gocen de este privilegio. 
Desde joven se ha dedicado a la confección, oficio que aprendió en el trayecto de su juventud y los empleos que obtuvo. En la actualidad labora desde su casa realizando confección a terceros. 
Con el fin de mejorar su productividad e incrementar sus ingresos, se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará en la compra de insumos como telas e hilos. Espera que con esta inversión su gran sueño de poderles ofrecer educación superior a sus hijos comience a ser parte de su realidad.
texts.en:
Nora, 50, is a woman motivated by the wish to see her four children receiving a professional degree. She says that she wanted to study herself, but due to the lack of resources in her family, she could not fulfill her dream. She now wants her children to have that privilege.

Since she was young, she has worked with tailoring, an activity she learned while growing up and thanks to the different jobs she has had. She now works from home and tailors for third-party customers.

With the intention to improve her productivity and increase her income, she is now requesting a loan to buy supplies, such as fabrics and threads. She hopes that this investment will help her make her dream come true: to offer her children access to higher education.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and threads.

loans.name: Merides Marcela

texts.es:
La Sra. Merides vive Guayaquil, tiene 53 años de edad. Ella empezó trabajando para una empresa de confección luego decidió comprase sus propias máquinas y comenzar con su negocio de confección de ropas para todo tipo de tallas.

Trabaja sola, todo el día, en su casa tiene el negocio en donde cose blusas, pantalones, interiores, de todo un poco.

Cada día le pide a Dios por su bienestar y que la libre de cualquier enfermedad a ella, está casada y su esposo se dedica trabajando en un taxi amigo, no tiene hijos.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar con más telas, máquinas e hilos para así poder coser con mayor facilidad y hacer más cosas que los clientes le piden. Además consiguiendo mas maquinas puede darles trabajo a demás personas para que le faciliten el trabajo y así poder obtener más ganancias para un mejor vivir para su familia.
texts.en:
Merides, age 53, lives in Guayaquil.  She started working for a clothes making company.  Later she decided to buy her own machines and to start her business of making clothes of all sizes.

She works alone all day.  She has her business at home, and she makes blouses, pants, and underwear.  She makes a little of everything.

Each day she asks God for her good health, and that he free her from any illness.  She is married, and her husband is working with an Amigo taxi.  She does not have children.

She wants to use the loan to buy more fabrics, machines, and threads.  This way she will be able to sew more easily and do the things that her customers request.  Also, by getting more machines she will be able to give work to other people.  This will make the job easier, and she will be able to get more income to live better with her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Zviad

texts.en:
Zviad is married and lives with his wife and two children (6 and 4 years old) in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia. Zviad requested loans from local financial institutions several times to start a family business, but without any success. His loan requests were always rejected because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Zviad rents property to earn a small monthly income. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the "subsistence poor" category. 

Zviad has requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. His loan request was approved as part of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides credit to start and restart businesses. The loans carry soft conditions and are provided the rural poor who typically do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low incomes. With the loan Zviad will renovate rooms in his house in order to rent them out and increase the income of the family.  He hopes that the new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate rooms and rent them out

loans.name: Masika

texts.en:
Masika is married with five children. She and her spouse both work tirelessly to provide the family with everything they need to have a better life.

Masika was a saleswoman at a shoe store for many years while her husband worked as a farmer. She came up with the idea to open her own business. With the help of small loans, she continues to sell shoes and now rents three commercial spaces and has four employees. Masika has several customers. Later on she would like to buy her own shop where she can generate better sales.

Masika is requesting this loan in order to purchase shoes, slippers, athletic shoes, and other items. As a result, her business will be well-stocked and she will be able to offer a good variety to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and other items.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba, a widowed mother of three living in Peofofordo near Abura, received no formal education. For the past five years, Araba has been selling mashed corn dough, known as fante kenkey, based upon a recipe taught to her by her mother, She uses the income from her sales to support herself and her children and save for her family's future.

Araba will use this loan to purchase more corn to prepare her recipe. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to develop her kenkey operations further to meet customer demand for her tasty treat.

loans.use: to purchase more corn to prepare her fante kenkey recipe.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama sells cassava, plantains, and utensils in Peofofordo near Abura. Ama has received schooling through junior high school.  She is divorced and has 2 children. Ama has been selling cassava, plantains, and utensils for 7 years now. She is responsible for supporting herself and paying for her children's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more vegetables and utensils to sell in the market. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her food and utensil selling trade.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and utensils to sell in the market.

loans.name: Phina

texts.en:
Phina is married with three children. All her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (her sister and older parents). 

She has had a business selling charcoal for 10 years. She sells to all kinds of people on a retail basis seven days a week at the market.  She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income from rental houses. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to build her own house.   

She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses includes rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina, es un claro ejemplo de que los imposibles solo radican en la mente. Dice que gracias a las experiencias que ha vivido, aprendió que basta con tener un sueño y luchar por alcanzarlo porque no existen obstáculos que sean más grandes que el deseo. 
Desde que se separó de su cónyuge asumió la totalidad de las responsabilidades del hogar y veló por el sostenimiento y la educación de sus tres hijos, por lo cual generar ingresos se convirtió en el tema de mayor prioridad. Razón por la cual comenzó vendiendo desde su casa algunos productos de la canasta familiar y hoy gracias a su disciplina y esfuerzo ha logrado montar su tienda.
Su sueño es realizar adecuaciones en la sala de su casa, lugar en donde tiene ubicada la tienda, con el fin de mejorar la calidad en el servicio y colocar una reja en la entrada para evitar los hurtos de los que ha sido víctima en varias ocasiones, por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito para realizar dicha inversión ya que no cuenta con capital propio.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a clear example that the impossible exists only in the mind. She says that she has learned from her own experience that it is enough to have a dream and strive to achieve it, because there are no obstacles in life that your dreams cannot overcome. 

Since she separated from her husband, she has assumed total responsibility for her home and has overseen the maintenance and education of her three children. Thus, earning a living became her highest priority and she began selling household products from her home. Today, thanks to her discipline and work she has managed to open a store. 

Her dream is to modify the living room in her house, which is the place where she has her store, so that she can improve service. She also wants to put a barred door at the entrance to prevent the thefts that others have been victimized by on several occasions. Consequently she is requesting a loan in order to make these investments, because she lacks sufficient capital.

loans.use: to buy a barred door for the entrance to her business.

loans.name: Teo

texts.en:
Teo is married with five children. Three of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.  She has a business selling local gin. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more jerrycans (a jerrycan is a robust container made from pressed steel) of local gin. 

She has been in this business for 5 years selling to all categories of people on a retail basis.  She works from her home and works five days a week. Her major business challenges include transportation, thieves and defaulters.  She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to see her children receive a university education. 

She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying for electricity.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans (A jerrycan is a robust container made from pressed steel) of local gin

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is married with two children. One of her children goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members.  

She has a business of selling green bananas, tomatoes, onions and cabbages.  She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 500,000/= from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas, boxes of onions, tomatoes and cabbages. She has been in this business for four years. 

Besides her food stall business, she generates additional income through animal farming. She works at the market six days every week and sells on a retail basis only.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation.  She aspires to start growing some of her own vegetables and also to educate her child and build her own home.   

She currently resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas, baskets of tomatoes,onions and cabbages

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. She is a married mother of three school aged children. She runs a clothing shop which has been operating for six years. She also employs one person in the business.
  
Veronica was introduced to Milango by her friends and joined in order to access credit. She is applying for a loan of 85,850 Kenya shillings to purchase new clothes to sell such as handbags, shoes, trousers, shirts etc.

Veronica believes the income from this loan will help her educate her children. She is focused on owning a wholesale shop despite the challenge of high costs from the suppliers which makes most of her items beyond reach of the public.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes to sell such as handbags, shoes, trousers, shirts etc.

loans.name: Pastora Emilia

texts.es:
Pastora de 59 años de edad, aprendió el oficio de la confección desde hace 40 años. Laboró en diferentes talleres de este gremio en donde perfeccionó el oficio y posteriormente se retiró para trabajar como independiente desde su casa y cuidar de sus hijos. 

Después de la separación con su cónyuge, esta mujer asumió todas las responsabilidades de su hogar y se vio en la necesidad de  laborar por más horas para generar los ingresos suficientes. En la actualidad se dedica a la confección a terceros, por lo cual su mayor reto es conseguir nuevos clientes para no reducir la producción y afectar su condición económica. Con el desarrollo de la actividad ha podido ofrecerles a sus tres hijos educación.
 
Su mayor sueño es poder incrementar su producción, y para eso se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de insumos como telas, lo que le permitirá generar mayores ingresos y obtener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Pastora is 59 years old. She learned the skill of making clothes 40 years ago. She worked in many different workshops where this trade was carried out. It was there she perfected her skills. Later, she left in order to work for herself from home and look after her children. 

After separating from her husband, she took on all the household responsibilities. As a result she needed to work more hours so as to have enough income. At present she works for third parties. Her greatest challenge is to get new clients to ensure that her productivity does not drop and in that way affect her economic circumstances. Her work has enabled her to provide her three children with an education.

Her dream is to be able to increase production. For this reason she is requesting a loan which she will invest in the purchase of supplies, such as fabric, which will enable her to generate higher income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Элмире 48 лет, имеет 5 детей.Эльмира уже многие годы занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 10,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Элмиры в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 1 дойная корова с приплодом,10 голов овец. Также, Элмира обрабатывает 1,5 га земли с картофелем и эспарцетом, служащим кормом для скота.Эльмира ежедневно сдает молоко. ежегодный доход составляет около 150,000 KGS. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Элмира обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 коровы и 5 овец, для увеличения доходов от продажи молока и перепродажи скота. Доходы от кредита Элмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса, Сейчас копят средства на покупку трактора.
texts.en:
Elmira is 48 years old and has five children.  Elmira has been breeding cattle for many years now.  She started her business with 10,000 som and, as a result of her hard work, today Elmira has 1 milk cow and its young, and ten head of sheep.  Elmira also works 1.5 hectares of land where she grows potatoes and sainfoin, which is used as feed for her cattle.  Elmira sells milk every day and her yearly income comes to about 150,000 KGS.  

With an aim to further developing her business, Elmira applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy a cow and five sheep in order to increase her income from from selling milk and cattle.  Elmira plans to invest the profit from the loan in further growing her business.  Now, she is saving up to buy a tractor.

loans.use: To purchase 1 cow and 5 sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase inventory and necessary appliances for her Mexican general store

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has one child, who attends school. He owns a retail shop, a business which has been running for five years. In this business, he mainly sells rice. James is also a truck driver.

He learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group, and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenge is the high cost of products. 

James is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy retail stock of rice. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve the living standard of his family. His ambition is to buy a van to transport the rice to other retailers.

loans.use: To buy retail stock of rice.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya.  He is married and has two school-going children. He owns a service shop which deals in repair and sale of tyres. He also sells clothes and has a barber shop, too.

Michael learnt about Milango through advertisements and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenge is lack of finance, a problem he sees partly sorted by this loan.

Michael is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy tyres and repair materials like tough bond glue. He believes that the business has improved enough to meet the required repayments for the loan despite high competition.

loans.use: To buy tyres and repair materials like tough bond glue.

loans.name: Rama

texts.en:
Rama lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has two children. He owns a retail shop, a business which has been running for two years. In this business, he mainly sells cooking utensils, basins, etc. Rama is also employed.

He learnt about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are high cost of transport. 

Rama is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to buy a stock of cooking utensils, basins, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve the living standard of his family. His ambition is to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy stock of cooking utensils, basins etc.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has one school-going child. She owns a grocery shop, a business which she has been running for twelve years. In the business, she sells foodstuffs, household goods and kerosene.

She learnt about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are inflation and high rental fees. 

Grace is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to buy grocery stock, e.g., maize, beans, rice and cooking fat. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living standard of her family and pay school fees for her children. She aspires to open other retail shops and invest in building a residential house.

loans.use: To buy grocery stock, e.g., maize, beans, rice and cooking fat.

loans.name: Fibian

texts.en:
Fibian lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is a single mother of four, and has one child who is still in school. She owns a salon which has been in operation for four years.  She mainly supplies beauty products like creams and conditioners.

She is applying for a loan of 52,250 Kenya shillings to purchase salon products such as cosmetics (creams and conditioners). Her aspiration is to open a larger salon despite the challenge of a seasonal sales period. Fibian will save the extra income from this loan toward her child`s education.

loans.use: To purchase salon products such as cosmetics (creams and conditioners).

loans.name: Mustiri

texts.en:
Mustiri lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is a married businessman and owns a farming business. He keeps poultry. Besides this, he is also a land and estate sales/rental agent. The poultry business has been running for eight years.

Mustiri employs one person in the farm. He learnt about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenge is lack of enough funds for business growth, a problem he sees sorted through this loan. 

Mustiri is applying for a loan of 57,500 Kenya shillings to buy more chicks, feed, and drugs and expand the rearing area. He will use the extra income to develop a residential house for the family and stop renting.

loans.use: To buy more chicks, feed, and drugs and expand the rearing area.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy grocery stock, e.g., maize, beans, rice and cooking fat.

loans.name: Rajab

texts.en:
Rajab lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya.  He is married and has four children, three of whom are in school. He owns a service shop which deals in welding repairs. 

Rajab learnt about Milango through advertisements and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. 

Rajab is applying for a loan of 83,450 Kenya shillings to buy a drilling machine. He believes that the business has improved enough to meet the required repayments for the loan despite high municipal fees.

loans.use: To buy a drilling machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To service his vehicle, change the tyres and carry out bodywork.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es: La Sra. Eugenia tiene 31 años, tiene dos hijos de las edades de 15 y 1 año, ella se dedica a la venta de comida en un de las calles concurridas de la zona de la Mutualista,   este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Eugenia va a usar este préstamo para compra de material de construcción para la construcción de una habitación en su casa,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo la falta de efectivo para la compra de estos materiales,  La Sra. Eugenia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las condiciones climáticas y también la competencia  de los demás negocios de comida por lo mismo que tiene que tratar de reducir sus costos y mejorar su sazón   de sus platillos, y va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de utensilios  y también en la ampliación de la misma para poder captar más clientes en las horas pico de almuerzo y cena, La Sra. Eugenia es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por esta oportunidad brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Eugenia, 31, has two children, ages 1 and 15. She makes a living selling food on one of the busy streets of the Mutualista area. This is her second loan with the institution. 

Eugenia will use this loan to buy construction materials to build a room in her house. She is applying for this loan because she lacks the money to buy these materials. 

Eugenia confronts some challenges in her business, such as weather conditions and competition from other food businesses. Consequently, she must try to reduce her costs and improve the seasoning of her dishes. She will use her earnings to buy utensils and to expand her business in order to serve more clients during the peak lunch and dinner hours.

Eugenia is a very hardworking person. She is happy to have the opportunity to receive this loan.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Elnura

texts.ru: Элнуре 47 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей. После окончания техникума, Элнура работала кассиром. Элнура на протяжении 25 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Элнуры в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 1 корову, 8 овец, лошадь и земельный надел мерою 0,9 га,  фасоль и картошку. Доходы от бизнес – деятельности Элнуры позволяют оплачивать повседневные затраты семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Элнура обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку КРС для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Элнура планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Elnura is 47 years old, married, and she has four children.  After finishing her vocational training, Elnura worked as a clerk.  For the last 25 years, she has been raising cattle.  Elnura started her business with 5,000 som (KGS) and, as a result of her hard work, today Elnura has one cow, eight sheep, one horse, and 0.9 hectares of land for beans and potatoes.  The profits from Elnura's business allow her to pay her family's day-to-day expenses.  

With an aim to further develop her business, Elnura applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy bulls for fattening and resale.  Elnura plans to invest the profits from her loan in further increasing the size of her herd.

loans.use: to purchase bulls for fattening

loans.name: Vyukakare Group

texts.fr:
Clothilde fait partie du groupe  Vyukakare  et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 40 ans et  est mariée à Jean, un plombier. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants  âgés de 1 à 17 ans,dont 5 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de matériels de plomberie : tuyaux, coudes, …depuis  5 ans. 

Elle est à son  sixième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de matériels de plomberie : tuyaux, coudes, …  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines années, elle  voudrait acheter une parcelle , construire une maison et voir ses enfants étudier et terminer les études.
texts.en:
Clothilde is a member of the Vyukakare and lives in Bujumbura. She is 40 years old and is married to Jean, a plumber. The couple have 6 children, aged between 1 and 17 years old, five of whom attend school. 

Clothilde has been selling plumbing materials (pipes, elbows, etc.) for 5 years. This is her 6th loan from Turame. Her Kiva-sponsored loan will increase her capital and allow her to buy a lot of plumbing materials such as pipes and elbows for resale, so that she can earn more money. In the coming years, she would like to buy a plot of land, build a house and watch her children get an education and finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy plumbing materials (pipes, elbows).

loans.name: Tanrikulu

texts.en:
Tanrikulu is 59 years old. He lives in Gardabani District with his wife, two sons and a daughter-in-law. Tanrikulu requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

Tanrikulu and his son work are artisans. They get orders to repair or to renovate buildings.  It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Tanrikulu requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit Tanrikulu will purchase all the needed equipment for an artisan, such as equipment for cutting stones, wood and walls. This will help him to work more productively and get more orders, which will increase the income of their family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: for purchasing equipment needed for an artisan to repair buildings

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en: Charlita is 38 years old, married with two children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns farmland, planting and harvesting vegetables for sale in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for over  four years and earns 5,000 PHP every month. She joined GDPMC in the year 2011 and now she has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She hopes for a bountiful harvest and to expand her cultivated area.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: La Sra. Marina tiene 43 años, tiene tres hijos de las edades de 3, 6 y 10 años, ella se dedica  a la actividad de venta de variedad calzados  tiene su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la zona de Gran Poder, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Marina va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de calzados por mayor   y así de esta manera brindar variedad de sus productos  a  sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias ya que esta época de fin de año tiene mucha demanda,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, La Sra. Marina va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de productos, La Sra. Marina es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que esta es la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta.
texts.en:
Marina is 43 years old and has three children, ages 3, 6, and 10. She makes a living selling a variety of footwear. She has a sales stall in the area of Gran Poder. This is her first loan with the institution. 

Marina will use this loan to buy wholesale footwear. She will then be able to offer a variety of products to her clients and increase her earnings, as there is a high demand for footwear at the end of the year. Her reason for applying for this loan is to continue improving her business. She will use her earnings to continue buying a variety of products. 

Marina is a hardworking person and she is happy to have been offered this opportunity, as this business is her only source of income.

loans.use: to buy wholesale footwear for men, women, and children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy everyday consumer products.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña maria de 54 años de edad vive con su esposo en casa propia posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, es una persona responsable y trabajadora quiere surtir su tienda realizar, una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, huevos, pan, bebidas, etc. Doña Maria tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que tendra mejor ingresos para su hogar.
texts.en:
Maria is 54 years old and lives with her husband in her own home. She owns a store where she sells basic necessities such as beans, milk, eggs, bread, and other items. 

She is a responsible and hard-working person that wants to grow her business to complete a new investment but she needs capital. For this reason she is requesting a loan that will allow her to buy basic grains, delicacies, eggs, bread, drinks, etc. Maria has good references of payment. She assures she will overcome the debt and at the same time she is confident that she will have better income for her household.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Marie Noelle's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été fondé depuis le cycle premier du banc villageois est il composé de 18 femmes unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles. 

Madame Edmée est la représentant, elle est mariée, âgée de 51 ans et mère de 11 enfants dont 4 scolarisés.
Elle est debout à droite de la photo la main levée habillée en grand boubou beige. Elle s'active dans le commerce de céréales et d'embouche porcine depuis longtemps, elle dispose d'une bonne éxpérience dans ce domaine pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis longtemps.
Son nouveau crédit de 200,000 francs cfa lui permettra de payer des sacs de mil d’arachides et des porcs pour mener son activité de commerce et d'embouche. 
Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettront de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires scolaires et sanitaires de ses enfants.
texts.en: This group was founded during the first cycle of the "banc villageois" and is made up of 18 women who are united through strong social and professional bonds. Edmée is the group's representative. She is 51 years old, married and the mother of 11 children, 4 of whom are attending school. She is standing on the right of the photo, with her hand raised, wearing a large beige boubou. She has been selling cereals and fattening pigs for a long time. She has a good experience in this line of work as she has been doing it for so long. Her new 200 000 franc loan will allow her to buy some bags of millet, some groundnuts and some pigs so that she can resell the cereals and fatten the pigs. The profits she makes will enable her to take care of the food, education and health needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy millet, groundnuts and pigs.

loans.name: Ngaïdo's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 2 femmes en bonne entente fait partie d'un banc villageois inauguré le 15 décembre 2008. 

La représentante de ce groupe, Ngaïdo, est une femme de mariée de 56 ans, mère de 4 enfant. Elle fait du petit commerce. Elle occupe une place au marché central de Louga. Elle vend des tissus, des chaussures et des ustensiles. Sur la photo, elle est debout en boubou violet.

Avec son prêt, elle voudrait acheter des tissus ganila, des chaussures et des ustensiles.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle va augmenter ses revenues et améliorer les conditions de sa vie familiale.
texts.en: This group of 2 women, who get along well, is part of a "banc villageois" which was inaugurated on the 15th of December, 2008. The group's representative, Ngaïdo, is a 56-year-old, married woman and the mother of 4 children. She is a small retailer and occupies a spot at the central market of Louga. She sells fabrics, shoes and kitchen utensils. She is standing and wearing a purple boubou in the photo. She would like to use her loan to buy "ganila" fabric, shoes and kitchen utensils. Her profits will increase her income and allow her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fabric, shoes and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Conception

texts.en:
Conception is 38 years old and married with two children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for over four years and earns 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) every month. 

She joined GDMPC in the year 2011, and now she has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, shampoo, soap, coffee and sugar. She  plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, shampoo, soap, coffee and sugar.

loans.name: Verlyn

texts.en:
Verlyn is 30 years old and married with four children. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates a food production business in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for over three years and earns 4,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) every month. 

She joined GDMPC in the year 2011, and now she has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to pay for the rental area. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for the rental area.

loans.name: Julia Narda

texts.es: Julia Narda de 63  años, soltera, madre de doce hijos, vive en un municipio de la ciudad de Chinandega ubicado al norte de este, hace 12 años inicio un negocio de venta de cosméticos de manera ambulante, negocio que fue por iniciativa propia después que quedo como madre soltera y  seis de sus hijos aún dependían  directamente de ella; decidió dedicarse a esta actividad porque le era difícil ejercer otros trabajos, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos tuvo una adolescencia y juventud muy trabajada y no pudo obtener una carrera ella aprendió lo esencial, que es leer aunque no sabe escribir, hace poco ella tuvo una recaída que le afecto en su negocio ahora está tratando de volver a surtir su inventario por lo tanto Julia está solicitando este crédito para surtir su negocio de cremas para manos, cuerpo, anti arrugas entre otras, perfumes, entre otros tipos de cosméticos. Julia agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Julia Narda is 63 years old, single, and the mother of 12 children. She lives in the municipality and city of Chinandega, located in the north east. Some 12 years ago she began a business selling cosmetics in the streets. She did so on her own initiative, after she was left as a single mother and 6 of her children still depended directly on her.

Julia Narda dedicated herself to this activity because it was difficult for her to exercise other forms of work. Sadly, for lack of economic resources, she had passed an adolescence and youth of very hard work and was unable to obtain a career. She learned what was essential, which is to read, though she didn't learn to write. 

A short time ago, she took a fall which affected her business. Now, she is attempting a come back and is building up her inventory as best she can. Julia is requesting this loan to stock her business with hand and body creams, anti-wrinkle creams, and perfumes, among other types of cosmetics. 

Julia is grateful for the help that Kiva investors offer to people with scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua, making it possible for them to have dignified work.

loans.use: to buy products such as creams, skin treatments, nail polish, eye shadow, vanities, blush, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Juan Agustin

texts.es: Juan Agustín tiene 63 años, es casado, padre de tres hijos, vive en una comarca de un municipio que se encuentra al norte  de Chinandega, él se dedica a la compra y venta de chatarra (desperdicios de hierro, electrodomésticos en mal estado,cobre,aluminio, materiales de construcción entre otros) de manera ambulante desde hace diez años. El viene de una familia de muy bajos recursos económicos, desde pequeño él ha tenido que trabajar para poder tener en su mesa el pan de cada día y sacar adelante a su familia  aún a su edad no pierde las esperanzas de salir adelante, tiene metas y sueños; el negocio de chatarra no cubre todas las necesidades de su hogar a lo cual no podía quedarse de brazos cruzados por lo que optó por utilizar su camioneta que esta un poco viejita, para ofrecer servicios de acarreo a las personas de comarcas aledañas, dentro de sus metas y sueños esta poder muy pronto con los proximos creditos cambiar su vehiculo para ampliar su negocio y brindar un servicio mucho mejor. Juan Agustín está solicitando este crédito para invertir en su negocio de chatarra y reparar su camioneta que necesita urgentemente ser arreglado y modificada. Actualmente esta muy agradecido por el apoyo que le brindan a los países de bajos recursos, como lo es Nicaragua.
texts.en:
63-year old Juan Agustín is married and has three children. He lives in a municipality north of Chinandega. Juan buys and sells scrap metal, broken electrical appliances, copper, aluminum, construction supplies etc. He sells the materials in the streets, a job he’s had for ten years.

Juan comes from a poor family, and ever since he was a young boy he’s had to work to put bread on the table and help his family get ahead. Even now he still hopes for a better future and has his goals and dreams.

In his current job he does not earn enough to buy all his family’s needs. He’s not the type of man to wait around with his arms crossed so he has decided to use his old truck and offer transportation services to people in distant communities.

One of Juan’s goals and dreams is to be able to use the upcoming loan and quickly change his vehicle so he can expand his business and offer a much better service. He is seeking a loan to invest in his scrap business and repair his truck which urgently needs some work. He is very grateful for the support that is given to poor countries like Nicaragua.

loans.use: buy more scrap metal and repair his truck

loans.name: José Jorge

texts.es:
José tiene 54 años de edad, esta casado y tiene tres hijos. Vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos; dos varones de 23 y 19 años de edad y una mujer de 20 años de edad.  Desde la edad de los 10 años se dedica a la agricultura; debido a que sus padres le enseñaron a sembrar maíz, maicillo, etc. José no asistió a la escuela, ya que esta quedaba muy lejos de su casa, por lo que se dedicaba de tiempo completo a los trabajos agrícolas.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para limpiar, comprar insumos para cultivar y la otra parte para comprar un par de terneros los que alimentara con sácate y tuza de la cosecha pasada. Así, aprovecha este alimento y no lo perderá y empezara a preparar el terreno para su otra cosecha.
texts.en:
José is 54 years old, married and has three children; two sons aged 23 and 19 and a daughter aged 20. They all live together. Since he was 10, José has worked in agriculture. His parents taught him to grow corn and sorghum, among other crops. José could not go to school because it was located far from where he lived, so he worked full time in agriculture.

With the loan he is requesting at Fundación Campo, he will clean and cultivate the fields, and buy supplies. He will also buy two calves that he will feed with fodder and husks from the previous season. In this way, he will not waste this feed and will prepare his land for another season.

loans.use: to clean and sow his land and buy supplies. Also to buy two calves.

loans.name: Pelegia

texts.en:
Pelegia is 49 years old and married with three children. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for over three years and earns 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) every month. 

She joined GDMPC in the year 2011, and now she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, soaps, sugar and canned goods.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, soaps, sugar and canned goods.

loans.name: Basilio Jacinto

texts.es:
El señor Basilio Jacinto es casado, tiene 43 año de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 8 hijos, se dedica a la artesanía, especialmente a tejer cortes típicos, inició este negocio ayudando a su familia y hasta la fecha lleva 31 años de experiencia en este trabajo.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos de diferente clases y colores para mejorar su negocio. Espera en el futuro tener una fabrica y tener trabajadores.
texts.en:
Sr. Basilio Jacinto is married and 43 years old. He never had the opportunity to go to school. He has eight children and earns his living doing crafts, especially weaving material for traditional clothing. He started out helping in the family business and now has 31 years of experience doing this kind of work.

He is seeking a loan to buy different types and colours of yarn to improve his business. In the future Basilio hopes to have a factory and employ people to work there.

loans.use: to buy yarn

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 59 years old and widowed with three children. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates a business venture, selling a variety of vegetables to earn a living, and she's been six years in this business. 

Each month, she earns 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional vegetables to sell. In 2009, Rosalina joined GDMPC. Positively, she simply hopes for the business to improve.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Dominguita

texts.en:
This is Dominguita. She previously accessed a loan of 10,000 PHP that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures. She has been in this business for 6 years now.

She would like to apply for another loan of 10,000 PHP to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Dominguita dreams of expanding her business and hopes to live according to the will of God. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Olga Isabel

texts.es:
La Sra. Olga vive en Guayaquil, tiene 39 años de edad. Ella nos cuenta que después de su incorporación en la universidad obtuvo el título de Veterinaria, instalo en su hogar su negocio con un capital que tenia. Ella ama a los animales.

No tiene ninguna dificultad, no está casada, es una mujer soltera con tres hijos unos 1 año, otro de 5 años y otro de 12 años que está en una escuela fiscal.

Por sus hijos ella sigue adelante en lo que hace, se esfuerza por darles lo mejor. Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos quimicos y asi seguir laborando y tener su propio hogar. Para así darle un mejor bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Olga, 39, lives in Guayaquil.  She tells us that after she graduated from a university with a degree in veterinary sciences, she set up a business in her home with some capital that she had.  She loves animals. 

She has not had any difficulties.  She's not married; she is a single woman with 3 children aged 1, 5, and 12.  Her children attend public school.

Olga works hard to make progress with her work so that she can give the best to her children.  With this loan, she wants to buy chemical products. She wants to continue working so that she can buy a home.  In this way, she could provide for her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy more chemical products

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
This is Evangeline, 43, a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is happy and single and manages her household while operating the business.  She is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Evangeline operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling individual pieces. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

She is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP to help her continue the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Evangeline hopes to open another store and dreams of having a good and peaceful life.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and she also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God that she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is married and works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy more items like rice, bread, soft drinks, and other groceries.

Herminia has been in this business for 11 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Herminia wishes to save enough money to build a grocery store at the public market.

loans.use: to buy items like rice, bread, soft drinks, and other groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rolls of synthetic suede material and taffeta wholesale

loans.name: Antonio Sigifredo

texts.es:
El Sr. Antonio vive en Guayaquil. El tiene una tercena en donde vende carnes, costillas, mondongos. El dice que escogió esta actividad porque le gustan las ventas y es una buena forma de vivir.
Esta actividad la realiza solo y empieza desde las 6:00 de la mañana hasta las 1:00 de la tarde, todos los días dice que las ventas son diariamente.

No tiene ninguna dificultad todo le va bien con la ayuda de Dios, siguen adelante, está casado su esposa es secretaría de una empresa, tiene un hijo de 11 años de edad que estudia en una escuela fiscal.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar carnes, costillas para poder vender y asi en un futuro poder viajar por algunos países, terminar de construir su casa, comprarse un automóvil. Para poder transportar con facilidad sus productos.
texts.en:
Antonio lives in Guayaquil.  He has a butcher's shop where he sells meat, ribs, and tripe.  He says that he chose this activity because he enjoys sales and because this is a good way to make a living.

He works on his own every day from 6am until 1pm.  He says that he makes his sales daily.

He has no difficulties, and everything is going well. Thanks to the help of God, he is continuing ahead.  He is married, and his wife works for a company as a secretary.  They have an 11 year-old child who attends public school.

With this loan, he wants to buy meat and ribs to sell.  This way in the future he will be able to travel abroad, finish building his house, and buy himself an automobile so that he would be able to easily transport his products.

loans.use: to buy meat and ribs

loans.name: Ma. Ana

texts.en:
This is Ma. Ana, 38, a resident of Malibay, Pasay City, Philippines. She is a mother to her children and is married to Alberto, a driver. She, with the help of her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Ma. Ana operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to use cooking gas for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.
