texts.en: Lina is a 22-year-old lady, studying English language at one of the Jordanian Universities. Since she depends on herself for a living, she decided to take an educational loan to be able to pay for her semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees as she studies English at university.

loans.name: Gharam

texts.en: Gharam is 21 years old. She is the oldest sister for three brothers and one sister. Gharam could not register into a university but she was able to enroll into one of the Jordanian Diploma colleges. She is applying for an educational loan to support her in paying for the semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is a 45-year-old married woman. She is a mother to eight sons and five daughters. Her husband is a worker and receives a low salary which is not enough to cover all the family's needs.

Farida is a successful woman. For the past seven years, Farida has been raising and selling sheep and sheep products, which has been a profitable project and a second helper source of income to her family. However, her business also needs more support to get bigger and make improvements.

Farida is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing more sheep. This will increase the capital of the project and increase sales in order to improve the family's income.

Farida is pictured next to the sheep she is raising.

loans.use: To purchase more sheep.

loans.name: Motaz

texts.en:
Motaz is a 31-year-old single young man. He is employed and receives a low salary which is not enough to cover all his needs.

Motaz wants to improve his housing conditions, so he is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing and installing new windows to his house. Taking this loan will offer to Motaz better living conditions and enable him to enjoy living in his house.

Motaz appears in the photo.

loans.use: To install new windows to his house

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Najah is a 48-year-old conservative woman. She asked her son to take her place in the photo.
Najah is a mother of three sons and one daughter, who is now married. One of her sons is Mohammad, a 23-year-old university student who still has around one year before graduating with a bachelor’s degree in Mechatronics Engineering. Now Najah is applying for an educational loan to support her son and pay for his semester fees.

loans.use: pay for her son's semester fees as he completes his last year of studying Mechatronics Engineering.

loans.name: Awatef

texts.en: Awatef is a 21-year-old married lady. She has one son. Besides being a mom, Awatef goes to the university to study School Student Guidance. She is now applying for a loan to pay for her semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees as she studies School Student Guidance (guidance counselor)

loans.name: Myassar

texts.en: Myassar is a 55-year-old widow. She has 6 children, where most of them are university students. For that she has applied for an educational loan to pay part of their semester fees.

loans.use: to pay part of her children's semester fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for equipment, advertising and publicity for a women's healthcare clinic.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goats for rearing and after sometime resell them.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a father of two girls and one boy. He is still working in the car repair shop. 

The previous loan has helped in increasing the quantity of car oil they have available to cover the shop’s and the customers’ needs. He is now applying for another loan to buy more tires and new tools for the shop.

loans.use: to get more tires and new tools

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a hardworking, 34 year-old married man with 7 children living in Kyenjojo-Uganda. He got his start operating a small restaurant, which allowed him to save money for the general merchandise to stock the retail shop and to help him look after his family. John has six years' experience and he works at least 12 hours a day. His business is located in a trading center that attracts many customers. However, he has a challenge of inadequate capital to meet people’s demands. Therefore, John is requesting a loan to purchase sugar, soap, rice, salt, and sodas for the retail shop. John dreams of becoming a wholesaler and building a permanent residence for his family.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, soap, rice, salt, and sodas for his retail shop.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 57-year-old married man with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. For 30 years now he has been an agriculturalist, growing crops and rearing poultry. The business has been very lucrative, and in a day he collects over 300 eggs which he sells to restaurants near by.

Charles intends to use the loan to buy poultry feed. High cost of feed and diseases affect his business growth. His dreams are to educate his children up to university and to buy more chicks that can provide him with eggs to supply his current market and venture into new ones.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, a 27-year-old, hardworking married man, lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda, with his three children aged 6, 4 and 2. For the past year, he has been in the transport business as a motorcycle driver, working to help meet his family's basic needs. It is a challenging job, thanks to poor roads (especially in the rainy season, when they become almost impassable) coupled with high fuel and transportation costs. 

David has a personal goal of building a permanent house and venturing into agriculture. He is requesting this loan so he can buy land for both cultivation and construction purposes.

loans.use: to buy land for cultivation and construction.

loans.name: Lenard

texts.en: Lenard is a 35-year-old man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer who grows a variety of foods which he sells to the local market. Like most farmers he is challenged by unpredictable weather changes and price fluctuation, both of which affect his projected yields. He has a business plan to venture into modern farming, and dreams of building rental houses and educating his children up to the university level. Lenard intends to use the loan to buy seedlings and pay labor.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and pay labor.

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
22-year-old Harrison used his previous loan to buy general merchandise to sell. He is a married man with one child living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. After failing to continue with school, he decided to set up a retail shop with money he had saved up from from casual labor and coffee sales, both of which he still does. 

Harrison is the bread winner of the family and his dream is to educate his child up to the university level and own a wholesale shop. His limited capital can make it difficult to meet the increasing demands of his customers. Harrison intends to use this loan to buy general merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchadise such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is a 29-year-old married man with three children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has been a teacher for three years and was inspired into service by his desire to serve his nation, and he believes there could be no better way to serve than to teach young people. He also gets some side income from a retail shop. 

Jonathan's dream is to move up in his studies and attain a degree as minimum qualification, eventually gaining an administrative position and earning more income. Jonathan intends to use the loan to pay his school fees.

loans.use: to pay his own school fees.

loans.name: Ngailut Dailou Group

texts.en:
Ngailut Dailou, which stands for “The Eternal Love”, is the name of the group and Lhingjanei is the featured member. She has her hand raised in the photo. “It is hard growing up without a father, but its easy when you have a fantastic mother who plays both roles” was the word of her only son who is married with kids. He’s a graduate and a very responsible person.  

Lhingjanei sheepishly quotes that “Chickens are her lucky charm” as she had tried her hands on other income-generating activities that ended in vain.  Chicken selling gives her more of what she wants and makes good money when she sells them in the market.  She has been into this chicken selling business for many years. She raises them in her home yard and takes the fully-grown chickens to the bi-weekly market, which falls on Tuesday and Friday.

With the loan, she will buy chicks, feed and materials to construct a bigger chicken coop. She will continue her chicken selling business and will try to do some savings with the group members. This savings will be beneficial when Lhingjanei is not in the position to earn or engage herself in any form of income-generating activity. She also shares that her savings will act as a pension when she gets old.

The members say, “Kiva is a blessing in disguise for our group and we are looking forward to them helping us. We will also try our best to work in unity and always keep our words. Long live Kiva”.

loans.use: To buy chicks, feed and materials to construct a bigger chicken coop.

loans.name: Ame

texts.fr: Mère de 02 enfants tous scolarisés âgés de 13 et 08ans, madame Ame a pour conjoint un chauffeur et est âgée de 40ans. Pour aider ce dernier dans les charges du foyer, elle fait un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des pagnes et des produits de  mercerie activité qu’elle associe à sa profession de couture depuis 2006. Avec le bénéfice de cette vente, elle veut assurer le développement de son activité tout en assurant l’épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en:
Ame is the mother of two children, aged 13 and 8, who both go to school.  She is 40 years old and married to a driver.  

In order to help her husband provide for the family, she is taking a first loan with WAGES.  She will use her loan to buy some "pagnes" (colorful West-African fabrics) and sewing supplies.  She has been adding this retail business to her main professional activity (sewing) since 2006.

With the profits from her sales, she wants to ensure the development of her activity and the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy "pagnes" and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Mary Lom Group

texts.en:
Tingbem is pictured with her hand raised and she is with the Mary Group. She has been running a paan shop in the village for the past eight years and earns extra income for the family by engaging in weaving. Life in her village gives fewer chances to Tingbem to earn and she finds it hard to refill her stock for paan-dukan due to lack of capital.  She sells essential commodities like peas, chili, sugar, onion, etc. In the day time, she is busy running her paan dukan and at night she weaves for additional income. Her woven products include traditional shawls, wraparound skirts, and scarves for women in general.  Tingbem takes orders and weaves accordingly. Tingbem plans to use this loan to refill her store's stock and buy more yarn for weaving. In the future, she wishes to expand her Paan Dukan into a General Store and own a shop in the market where she could sell her woven products in abundance. This loan will help her fulfill this dream.

Tingbem's husband is engaged in the construction of houses. His income depends entirely on the amount of work available. Thus, Tingbem hopes to get advanced carpentry tools for her husband when she is able to make a profit from the loan she avails. She wanted her husband to be independent in earning his own wages since he was working under the head construction workers. Due to the family’s poor financial condition, she believes that by availing this loan she could improve her family financial status. Her present plan is to build a house for themselves and to send her kids to private Institutions. For this purpose, together with her husband, Tingbem works hard.
 
The extension of a Kiva and WSDS loan will act as a helping hand in bringing up her kids and running her business and empower her social and financial status.

She sends millions of hugs and kisses to all the lenders.

loans.use: To buy stock for her shop and yarn.

loans.name: New Saikul Women Shg Society Group

texts.en:
“Dimpu Hotel” was a tea stall at the centre of the Saikul market and is what Veineineng, who is the featured member with the raised hand of New-Saikul Group, is well known for. Her tea stall did not accommodate a number of customers, so she took orders and served her customers by taking the tea and the toast/puri to their respective stalls/shops. Most of her customers are shop owners and vegetable vendors. Thus, these catering services are necessary for Veineineng's business success.

Because of her success, Veineineng bought a bench for her tea stall where she could accommodate her customers.  But her dream was shattered when her tea stall was demolished by the government in order to construct a new market shed. Starting all over again with a new tea stall would require a rented shop, for which she needed a security deposit. So, Veineineng considered taking up poultry because she had raised a few chickens before in her yard. She used to raise pigs as well.

This Kiva loan will support her plan and hopefully it will be accomplished. She feels the urge to run a poultry farm because Veineineng believes that she can do well in poultry and expand her business. By availing a loan, she will fulfill her purpose by purchasing more chicks and starting a poultry farm.
 
The other members of the group are engaged in weaving, selling used clothes, running a piggery, and running a paan-dukan. They are cheerful while sharing their experiences and hopeful that WSDS will continue to be a guardian angel in the days to come.

loans.use: To buy chicks and feed to start a new poultry farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Yonasan

texts.en: Yonasan is a hardworking, 30-year-old man living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has a retail shop, and he started the business after dropping out of school. He worked as a casual laborer, and after saving enough money he started his current business. Price fluctuations and high rental fees pose challenges to the growth of his business. His dream is to own a wholesale shop. Yonasan intends to use the loan to buy merchandise such as salt and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as salt and soap to sell

loans.name: Laimanai Lup Group

texts.en:
The featured member with her hand raised is Premita and she belongs to Laimanai Lup. All the group members live together in the same vicinity.  Premita says she has always been interested in tailoring since childhood. She used to tailor before her marriage and continued after she married. She sews mosquito nets, bed sheets, and cushion covers. She stitches these items because they are more profitable and take less time. She says that these items are in high demand at the market and have no risk of expiration.

Demand for Premita’s tailored items is high during holidays, which in Manipur fall in the months of March, October, November and December.  They are used as gift items on occasions like weddings, childbirths, send-off ceremonies, Ningol Chakkouba (Daughters' home visit day) and house-warmings.
 
She cannot supply all the demands of her customers because she is not able to get enough cloth materials due to a shortage of money. She is poignant about this and hopeful to come into a solution in the future.

With this Kiva loan, Premita will contact the cloth retailer, deposit a security, and purchase plenty of supplies for tailoring. Her future plan is to get two or more sewing machines and hire an additional tailor for more productivity. 

The other group members are engaged in wood businesses and jewelry businesses. All the group members are positive and hopeful that affiliations with KIVA will be beneficial.

loans.use: To purchase extra sewing machines and cloth supplies for tailoring.

loans.name: Eddy

texts.en: Eddy runs a small stall where he sells snacks, drinks, cell phone accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. He is an entrepreneur with four persons living in his house. He joined Ruma with only $10 capital to do transactions about 10 months ago and still feels really excited to expand his business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicingng bill payments for the customers. For the last three months,  he has around $ 2 - 25/day sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues, he needs more working capital in order to be able to do transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr: Afiwa est une femme âgée de cinquante-deux ans. Elle est mariée à un infirmier. La cliente travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1995. Elle exerce comme activité la vente des produits d’alimentations générales pour ses clients à sa maison. Elle a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d'améliorer le commerce(en achetant plus de marchandises). Avec ses profits supplémentaires, elle voudrait acheter un terrain. Dans les prochaines années, Afiwa voudrait achever l`avancement et la récréation d'autres boutiques. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit une condition de vie améliorée.
texts.en:
Afiwa is a 52-year-old woman, married to a male nurse.  She has been working as a reseller since 1995, selling basic food supplies to her customers, from home.

She has requested a third loan from WAGES in order to improve her commercial activity and buy more goods.

Afiwa would like to use her additional profits to buy a plot of land.  In the coming years, she would like to open and develop other shops.  She says that with her profits, she is expecting her living conditions to improve.

loans.use: to buy basic food supplies.

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en: Ayman is 21 years old and married. He has worked in a barber shop for a few years and is now planning on opening his own barber shop. He needs some money to start his project, to buy shaving tools and some hair cosmetics. Ayman has requested a 1000 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help Ayman start his own project. The photo is of Ayman in his barber shop.

loans.use: to pay the costs of preparing his barber shop

loans.name: Hannington

texts.en: Hannington is a 43-year-old married man with with five children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. Thirteen years ago he decided to venture into agriculture. Like most farmers, he is challenged by seasonal weather changes, especially prolonged drought. His dream is to progress into modern farming activities. He is determined to change his future and that of his children by educating them up to the University, and his prayer is that they graduate and work for reputable institutions. Hannington intends to use this loan to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Anani

texts.fr: Anani est un homme âgé de 39 ans. Il est marié à une revendeuse. Il a deux enfants de 15 et 12ans qui vont à l’école. Anani travaille comme projectionniste depuis 2011. Il projette des matchs de football et les enfants viennent aussi jouer aux jeux. Anani a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter un projecteur. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité. Dans les prochaines années, Anani voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité et assurer le bien être de la famille.
texts.en:
Anani is a 39-year-old man, married to a reseller.  He has two children, aged 15 and 12, who both go to school.  

Anani has been working as a projectionist since 2011.  He projects soccer games, and children also come to play (video) games.

He has requested a third loan from WAGES in order to buy a projector.  He wants to reinvest in his business.  In the coming years, he would like to expand his activity and ensure the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to buy a projector.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo. The picture is of her husband in his new home. 
Hanan is 33 years old, married, and from a small village near Nablus. She has one son and one daughter. Her husband makes a very low wage, which barely covers the family needs. Hanan and her husband are looking to improve their home. She does not have enough money for this, so she needs a loan of $1900 USD from FATEN. This loan will help the family to improve their home.

loans.use: to pay the costs of improving the family home

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.ru:
Руслан занимается выращиванием овощей в теплицах на своем участке в с Водяное уже 6 лет. Живет с женой и двумя детьми в своем доме. В основном выращивает помидоры, огурцы, редис. Руслан - трудолюбивый, у него современные теплицы, есть наемные работники. Последние несколько лет всю прибыл он вкладывал в развитие бизнеса. В следующем году хочет построить дом для своей семьи. Руслан просит предоставить ему кредит для закупки угля для отопления теплиц.

Примечание: на фото Руслан вместе со своей женой.
texts.en:
Ruslan lives in Vodyanoye and he grows vegetables in greenhouses, on his own piece of land.  He has been involved in this activity for six years already.  He lives with his wife and two children in his own house.

Ruslan essentially grows tomatoes, cucumbers and radishes.  He is a hardworking man who owns modern greenhouses and hires laborers.  In the past years, he invested all his profits into the development of his business.  Next year he wants to build a house for his family.

He is requesting this loan for the purchase of coal, to heat his greenhouses.

Note:  The other person in the photo is Ruslan's wife.

loans.use: to buy coal to heat his greenhouses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grocery stock e.g. fruits, maize, beans, rice and cooking fat.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is a married business lady. She owns a retail shop--a business which she has been running for almost two years. She sells foodstuffs, household goods, etc.

She learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group, and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is a lack of having adequate money for a business expansion--a problem she sees partly sorted with this loan. 

Naomi is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya Shillings to buy soft drinks, maize, beans, rice and cooking fat. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve on the living standards of her family. She aspires to own a wholesale business.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, maize, beans, rice and cooking fat

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. She is a married mother of seven children, six of whom are in school. She runs a cafe, which has been in operation for eight years. She also has a transport business, running a three-wheeler. Francisca employs nine other people in her business.

Francisca was introduced to Milango by her friends and is asking for a loan of 41,900 Kenya Shillings to buy sugar, baking flour, frying oil, cereals, etc.

Despite the challenge of power outages, Francisca believes she can save the extra income for the education of her children, provide a means of income to the other employees, and also use part of the money to open a restaurant.

loans.use: To buy sugar, baking flour, frying oil, cereals etc.

loans.name: Rebeccah

texts.en:
Rebeccah is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. She is a married mother of three school children. She runs a clothing shop that has been operating for three years. She also runs a grocery stall beside her clothing business. 
 
Rebeccah was introduced to Milango by her friends and joined to access credit. She is applying for a loan of 85,900 Kenyan shillings to purchase new clothes (e.g., shoes, trousers, shirts) and handbags to sell.

Rebeccah believes that the income from this loan will help her to educate her children. She is focused on her goal of owning a wholesale shop despite the challenges of high stocking costs and transporting the goods from suppliers.  Operating a wholesale shop would likely make most of her items beyond the public's reach. She looks forward to establishing a larger boutique.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes (e.g., shoes, trousers, shirts) and handbags to sell

loans.name: Nathaniel

texts.en:
Nathaniel lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has one child. He owns a welding shop which he has been running for three years. Nathaniel employs two other people in his business.

Nathaniel learned about Milango through advertisements and joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are competition and a lack of capital. The latter problem will be mitigated in part by this loan.

Nathaniel is applying for a loan of 83,450 Kenyan shillings to buy welding bars, plates, and rods. Despite the high competition, he believes that the business will improve enough to allow him to meet the required loan repayment and effectively provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy welding bars, plates, and rods.

loans.name: Franklin

texts.en:
Franklin lives in the Kongowea area of Coast province. He is married and has two children. 

Franklin owns a carpentry workshop, which he has been operating for 7 years now. He started the business using his savings. Franklin learnt about Milango through friends with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operation of the business. The challenge he is facing is purchasing stock. 

Franklin is applying for a loan of 41,850 KES to buy timber, nails, and other equipment for the workshop. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to repair the broken machines and service them and also provide for his family’s basic needs. 

His future plans are to expand the business to own a larger outlet.

loans.use: to buy timber, nails, and other equipment for the workshop.

loans.name: Kamleh

texts.en:
Kamleh is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo. He is pictured next to the vegetable cart. 

Kamleh is a married woman from Tulkarem city. She is a mother to three sons and two daughters. Kamleh works on a small fruits and vegetables cart  and her husband is a worker but they would like to improve the family income by buying more seasonal fruits and vegetables to resell. 

Kamleh is requesting a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help the family to improve their income by buying more fruits and vegetables to sell again.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Waleed

texts.en: Waleed is a 18 year old young man. He is a university student and wants to complete his studies. He is requesting a 600 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of his new laptop, which he is pictured with. The laptop will help Waleed with homework, reports, and his studies generally. The laptop will ensure that Waleed has a better future and improves the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet lives in the Nanyuki area of Central province, Kenya. She is a married mother of five children. Four of her children are in school. 

She owns a tea tree farming business. She also has an agricultural farm dealing in maize, beans, potatoes, etc. on a small scale and this farm has been running for 26 years.

Janet learnt about Milango through an employee who invited her to the group and she joined the group with an aim of accessing credit to better her business operations. The main challenges she faces are lack of water and theft of the farm produce.

Janet is applying for a loan of 10,734 KES to buy tea tree seedlings for the business. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to expand the agricultural business. Her future plan is to open a cereals shop in 5 years.

loans.use: to buy tea tree seedlings for the business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. She is a married mother of three children. She runs a clothes shop which has been operating for fifteen years. She also owns some rental houses from which the family earns some income.

Mariam was introduced to Milango by her friends and joined to access credit. She is applying for a loan of 52,300 KES to purchase new clothes for sale, like handbags, shoes, trousers, and shirts. 

Mariam believes the income from this loan will help her educate her children.She is focused on owning a whole sale shop despite the challenge of high cost of stock from the suppliers which makes most of her items beyond reach of the public.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes for sale, like handbags, shoes, trousers and shirts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries like vegetables, cereals, rice and cooking fat.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a resident of Kongowea, Kenya. He is the married father of two school-going children. Julius runs a primary school as an investment and began this out of the desire to provide affordable education to the children in the vicinity. He employs six teachers in the school. The school has been running for five years.

Julius was introduced to Milango by an employee and is applying for a loan of 21,100 KES to repair damaged desks.

Julius looks forward to offering boarding facilities in the future.

loans.use: to repair damaged desks.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya.  She is married and has two school-going children.  She owns a retail shop which has been running for two years.  In the business, she sells household goods.

She learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group.  She joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations.  Her main challenges are bad debts and physical exhaustion from walking long distances. 

Hannah is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to buy retail stock like toothpaste, toys etc.  The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve her family’s living standards and to pay school fees for her children.  She aspires to open a shop with a fixed location.

loans.use: to buy items for her retail shop, such as toothpaste and toys.

loans.name: Kenanga Indah Group

texts.en:
The Kenanga Indah Group needs a new loan with increasing size to continue business and to cover the price of feed.  The loans will be used to purchase super quality piglets and feed.

Ni Komang uses her loans to purchase 3 superior piglets and uses the rest for feed.  To reduce the cost of feed, she gives the piglets a traditional feed made from banana leaf.  She hopes the price will be high again because it is already nearing the holiday for Hindusm.

loans.use: to purchase 3 piglets and feed.

loans.name: Sait

texts.en: Sait runs a small stall where he sells snacks, drinks, cell phone accessories, and mobile phone airtime credits. He is an entrepreneur who has five persons living in his house. He joined Ruma three months ago because he wanted to increase his income and he is still really excited to expand his business selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments for his customers. For the last three months, he has around $ 25 - 40/day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business runs, he needs more working capital loan in order to be able to do transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To obtain more float to process payments on weekends

loans.name: Sari Madu Group

texts.en:
Ni Luh is a 25-year-old housewife with a 3-year-old toddler.  She has run the business since she has been married.  As the head of the Sari Madu group, Ni Luh and members received their fourth loans at 1,5M IDR each.

To increase business, Ni Luh will use the loan to purchase 2 superior piglets and super quality feed.  Ni Luh hopes MUK will still support their business until they can have enough capital to run the business by themselves.

loans.use: to purchase 2 superior piglets and super quality feed.
